story:
Who am I?

Hi! I am Maria-Cristina and I am writing to you from Ecuador, the middle of the world, and the point of departure to my next adventure in Bangalore, India.

Throughout my life, I have strived to be good citizen, contributing my efforts towards fostering a world for people to coexist peacefully despite their differences. I have chosen a career path in development, peace and sustainability, one which has taken me on a professional and personal journey through different organizations that I believe thrive to contribute to positive transformations Also, it has given me the opportunity to work side by side with children, indigenous and Afro-Ecuadorian populations, women, teachers, immigrant families, environment lovers, climate change fighters, youth, and volunteers; these people have made an impact in the way I perceive the world and have helped me become the person who I am today.

Most recently, for the past three years, I have tried my best to be a good Global Citizen role model for brave and curious high school seniors (Global Citizen Year fellows) taking a gap year in my country. The many experiences lived with them have inspired me to be a fellow myself at this point in my life, to leave my country and embark on a journey to India to keep learning about who I am, India, social impact work, and the world.

About The Fellowship:

The IDEX fellowship is a 6-month program that offers professional, cultural and social immersion for all over the world individuals interested in launching careers in the social impact sector. Specifically, IDEX places fellows alongside local entrepreneurs in innovative game changing organizations they’ve created for communities in India, and the world. Idex was founded on the idea that investing in yourself and others is one of the surest routes to ensuring social change. Learn more about the IDEX Fellowship here      

As part of the program, I have been placed with JAAGA (which means space in Hindi), a city-based community space that supports and connectscreative entrepreneurs in the arts, technology, social, and environmental sectors. Jaaga was founded in 2009, and operates from a living, expressive, and sustainable building in the center of Bangalore. I highly recommend you discover more about this unique building here

With JAAGA, I will be helping coordinate their Startup Program, which offers entrepreneurs the possibility to work, learn, and push each other to greatness. Mainly, I will be contributing to develop a targeted pilot program focused on women and socially focused entrepreneurs. Exciting!

How You Can Help Me Make It Happen

For this new adventure I will be volunteering my energy, enthusiasm, and passion to this job. For that, I will be personally covering the costs of my round-trip airfare (I am the fellow that will travel from farthest, so more people like you will know about Ecuador), visa, foreign registration, immunizations, health insurance. This is where you can join me, I am asking for the support of my friends, family, and anyone else who is willing to help me on my mission to help me raise funds for daily costs while in Bangalore. I sincerely appreciate the opportunity that I have been given by IDEX and JAAGA, and I am excited to make my dreams a reality...but just like many others in the world, I need a helping hand.

Want To Help But Can't Donate?

Connect me with your people! Share this page with friends, family, coworkers, do-gooders, anyone, everyone. You can also help connect me with your friends in India. Since the IDEX Fellowship will send me to India and the vibrant people within it for the first time, familiar faces will definitely help me acclimate and learn.

Or, wish me luck! Grateful to have your good wishes

Love and peace,

MC

campaign_city: Quito, the middle of the world, Ecuador

story: I began translating the New Testament Scriptures of the Ancient Church of the East directly into English, in 1995. Ten years ago, I completed the New Testament and began the Old Testament Books. The interest in the New Testament was much bigger; however, when I began translating the Old Testament, gradually interest in my translation project dwindled. This campaign will help me translate at a faster rate, as I'll be able to devote more time to it daily. The funds will be used to sustain me and provide for the Internet and publishing expenses.

story:
Hi, my name is Kristian

I turn to you with great hope that I would be able to create art with a better tool, that helps me create many new images pleasing others as well as me.

Please contribute a small amount that would be amazing for me as a valuable acquired by your generosity.

I wish for a WACOM Intuos For Creative Professional Pen & Touch Tablet (L) that I could form without qualitative restrictions. Please enable me to become a better creative graphics designer.

Thank you so much

                                                                                   


 If you want to see my work to know what you're supporting click there

story:
Money will be used for custom graphics and artwork for the game and pay for the first print run.

I've already written and published 4 guides on GameMaker: Studio. I've learnt lots along the way on how to produce, format and publish educational books. This will  be the best one yet.

It will cover the following RPG features:

  • Cash System
  • Weapons
  • Power Ups
  • Inventory System
  • Shop
  • Actions & Abilities
  • 1 on 1 Combat
  • Skills
  • Boss Battle System
  • Save System
  • Free Roaming
  • Puzzles & Mini Games
  • Experience Points

I've also created a poll where you can vote on and suggest elements to include.

 You can make your suggestions here and help shape this project.


The book will be about 200 pages. The first 100 pages will cover the design and game logic, the remaining 100 pages will cover the actual programming of the GML.

There are lots of perks you can choose from. Please support this project and share with your friends.

BONUS: Pledge $15 or More And Get The Following Series Of eBooks For FREE:

Worth $44.97 at full price.

More Info On The FREE Books Here: http://www.gamemakerbook.com/

story:
Schools for Change in Africa (a Denver-based nonprofit composed of returned Peace Corps Volunteers, as well as non-RPCV Coloradoans) is building a gender-equal middle school. The school will be built in Tolotama, a small village in Burkina Faso, West Africa, where there currently is not a middle school. Young children in this area (especially young females) who do not have access to a school often drop out, putting them at a higher risk for early marriage, STIs and unwanted pregnancies. Fundraising for the school construction is underway - but the first step is to install a water pump. This pump will provide clean, accessible water -- not just to the school but to the entire community.

Help is needed...your contribution will go directly to sending the President of the SCA board (Christie-Anne Edie) and the Executive Director of SCA (Rachel Whetstone) to Burkina Faso to oversee and assist with the installation of a water pump. Through a previous Indiegogo campaign, we raised about half the money that we need for the trip. This campaign is to help us raise the remaining money. If any additional money is raised, it will go directly to the installation of the pump!

story:
Build Something Important

Provide youth in marginalized communities with accessible arts education, leadership training workshops, mentorship opportunities and meaningful employment.

Double your Investment

If we can raise $5000, the Halsall Family Foundation will match each donation dollar for dollar! That’s $10,000 to celebrate 10 years of incredible Samba Kidz programming!

Drum Artz Canada And The Samba School Model

Samba schools were born in Brazil and use Samba music, dancing and art as an instrument for social change and a way to build community. Drum Artz Canada uses the Samba School model and Samba drumming to empower youth and teach the value of community.

Samba represents a way of life; a culture based on celebration of community that includes the participation of each individual regardless of race, class, age, ability or gender. Drum Artz applies the core values of Samba by using music and artistic expression as ‘equalizers’ that break down barriers of race and class, fostering channels of meaningful communication among diverse groups in our society. Drum Artz creates a social space where youth are encouraged to collaborate and perform, and where the success of the individual is critically dependent on the success of the group.

The Samba Kidz & Samba Youth Program

The Samba Kidz and Samba Program provide youth with meaningful learning experiences, leadership development opportunities, job skills training, meaningful employment and, of course, the joy of Samba music!

Our Samba Kidz receive training in Samba music, steel pan, visual arts, stilt walking and more, from some of Toronto’s most exciting professional artists. Within this structure of arts-based learning, our youth receive an experiential education in team building and collaboration through the collective creation of music and art, expanding their cultural outlook through an appreciation of world music, and the power of peer-to-peer mentorship as the older, more experienced players help teach novice musicians. Through performance opportunities at various events and major festivals around the city, Samba Kidz are also able to build self-confidence, experience positive civic engagement, and develop a broader sense of community.

Our Samba Youth participate in additional leadership training workshops and work on special skill-building projects. As youth continue to progress through the program, they have the opportunity to be paired with a professional mentor and explore potential career paths in a field of their interest. The Samba Youth program also offers youth meaningful employment opportunities as Interns or Youth Staff in our summer program. In addition to gaining practical job-skills training and experience, our Samba Youth take part in leadership workshops focusing on personal development (e.g. Goal Setting, Overcoming Obstacles, Mental Health, etc.) and participate in a self-evaluation process.

Accessibility

Our Samba Kidz and Samba Youth Program is a high quality arts and youth leadership program led by professional artists and passionate youth workers. While the costs associated with running a program of this caliber are quite significant, it is central to our organizational mandate to make this program accessible to all families.

As such, Samba Kidz is a highly subsidized program with 95% of our families receiving a financial subsidy of up to 90% or more of the total fee for our summer program, and our after school programs are offered for free. In order to support this model of funding, we rely heavily on the support of corporate sponsors, private foundations, government funders and individual donors like you!

Highlights

Since its inception in 2004, DAC has offered subsidized arts education programs for hundreds of kids and families in Toronto’s marginalized communities. The Samba Kidz Performing Troupe has performed at high profile events such as The Beaches Jazz Festival, WE Day, Kensington Festival of Lights, Muhtadi International Drum Festival, Easter Seals Telethon on CBC, and at Dundas Square with Brazilian megastar Carlinhos Brown. In 2010, DAC was named Royal Bank of Canada’s charity of choice and in 2011, Executive Director Gili Zemer, was given the Community Cultural Champion Award by the city of Toronto. In 2013, Samba Youth Jade Shortte, received an honorable mention in the national competition for the Urban Leadership Awards for her work with Drum Artz and “her commitment, dedication and leadership in her community, serving as a role model to children and aspiring musicians”. In 2014, Samba Youth Joshua Witter-Lucas won a Student Leadership Award from the Durham Black Educators Network.

story: My name is Billy Powell, I was born and raised in Indianapolis Indiana. I love basketball, especially basketball in Indiana. The game may not have been invented in Indiana but it was perfected there! I went to Broad Ripple High School from 1982-1986 and continued on to Indiana State University to obtain a degree in history and political science. I am in the process of writing two books, the first is called "The Top Fifity Indiana High School Basketball Players". The second is "A Pictorial History of Indiana High School Basketball".  I need your help to publish these two titles! from high school to college and even the NBA, basketball is king in Indiana! My perks include, your name in the book as a patron and supporter, a  free DVD of a record breaking game in 1983 which included Steve Alford in high school putting up 57 points in a Tournament game, and an autographed first edition copy of either book! if you have the passion for basketball from the state of Indiana like I do, your help is very well received! Your donations will go to the publishing costs of my book and the research materials needed for the completion of the books. Please check out my website Indiana-Basketball-Memories.com and check out my Facebook page-Indiana Basketball Memories Website! Thank you so much and look forward to sending you all DVDs and placing your name inside my books! God Bless-Billy

story:
COLUMNICATION - Let's Build Interactive Communication with Art

Interactive columns detect people's presence and behavior, creating amazing experience of sounds, lights and movements. The interaction between the viewer and the COLUMNICATION has been happening in the sensitive area of the installation, building up the ambience of emotional connection. Columnication itself is the ideological mirror of the relationship between  people. It represents different levels of communication in various situations. 

Let get involved in this interaction:

 

How does it work?

The columns spread emissions of ultrasound clouds through the sensitive area in order to receive back information of the surrounding area. A microcontroller inside creates and represents the unique profile of the viewer by changing the shape of the composition, the set of lights and sound of nature. The interaction depends on the distance, movement and number of persons.

 

Concept

Every human being has an individual and unique perception of the surrounding environment and is reacting in different ways. The columns recreate this complex fusion, throughout the interaction between the viewer and Columnication. Our installation creates bonds between technology and art. And this is the most valuable part of the concept because it gives the viewers the opportunity to participate in this piece of art.

 

Technical details:

6 interactive columns:

3 main columns with 2 active modules. 

  • 5 ultrasound sensors
  • Microcontroller
  • Firmware
  • Linear actuators
  • RGB LED’s
  • Stereo sound

3 columns with one active module each connected to the main.      

  • Linear actuators
  • RGB LED’s
  • Stereo sound      

 Materials:

  • Aluminum
  • Aluminum composite material (Bond)
  • Stainless steel   
  • Plastic
  • Elastic fabrics 

 

Who we are?

Kinetic Studio is a small studio for kinetic and interactive design founded by Angel Petkov. Kinetic is triggered by the opportunities of reaching the viewer by the kinetic art in order to awake more senses of perception and to realize interactions between the three components of art: author - work - viewer.

 

 

Participations

Exhibitions:

  • Kinetica Art Fair 2012, Kinetica Museum, London, UK.
  • MAD Museum 2012, Stratford, UK.
  • Elevation 2012, Sofia, Bulgaria.
  • Transform 2012, Thessaloniki, Greece.
  • In The Palace 2012, Balchik/Varna, Bulgaria.
  • DA Fest 2011/2012, Sofia, Bulgaria.

Advertising campaigns:

  • Heineken “The Date” 2012, Sofia, Bulgaria.
  • Heineken “Quality” 2012, Sofia, Bulgaria.

 

Why support us?

Your support is really important for us. It encourages us to continue our hard work on creating amazing art experiences and share it with YOU. Showing Columnication to Tokyo Designers Week 2013 will give us field of expression while bringing our little team to the worldwide scene of latest innovations in modern technology, design and art fields. 

 

We believe that we can contribute for the interaction between

                                    HUMAN - ART - NATURE

 

What We Need To Achieve Our Goal?

We are preparing this project for almost a year already. Now the prototypes for the first two objects are done. We need your support to fully complete 6 objects and bring Columnication to Tokyo Designers Week. The amount of money for the project is 39800 euro.

You can see the details listed on the table below:

What about the perks?

If you are excited of what we do, you would probably like what we have prepared for you. It’s not much but we were thinking hard, how to make you happy. There are many kinds of perks all about Columnication and Kinetic work. There are hand sketches, photo albums and so many others made especially for you. And we hope it’s going to be valuable for you as it is for us. Of course, every help will be appreciated on public in our website. For some of you we have prepared as a special gift – a wonderful weekend spent with our team when you can see how exactly we can make everything in motion.

PS: Please note that shipment and travel expenses are not included!   

  

 

Other Ways You Can Support us:

Thank you so much in advance and please let’s spread the world about this campaign. Use Indiegogo’s share tools, it's easy!

  • Blog about it,
  • Share it on social media - facebook, twitter, instagram, vine, etc...
  • Spread through word of mouth with your family, friends...
  • Smile
  • Like us on facebook http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kinetic/114152618...
  • Visit www.kineticbg.com
  • And every other kind that you imagine

          

    Every crazy dream is possible when we believe it!

                           Let's prove it together!

 

 

Special thanks

We would like to single out a few people, without whom this project wouldn't be possible:

Robotev.com

Simeon Yanchev - Hardware and Software

Jordan Stoyanov - Project Engineer

Lubomir Grozdanov - PR

Stela Stoynova - Documentation

Radoslav Georgiev - Movie Director

Elena Gamalova - Graphic Designer

Petar Gamalov - Project Consultant

Ivan Jordanov - Web Design

Plamena Simeonova - Textile Designer

Your help and support, along the way of this project, are appreciated more than you will ever know it.
 

FAQ

1. What is Kinetic art?

Kinetic art is an art that contains moving parts or depends on motion for its effect. The moving parts are generally powered by wind, a motor or the observer. Kinetic art encompasses a wide variety of overlapping techniques and styles.

2. For whom is Columnication suitable?
For every, gallery owner, brand, advertiser, collector, fashion designer, art lover...

3. Maintenance
It's very easy to do. Just don't use it out side.

4. How can I get one?
Just contact us!

 
For any other questions don't hesitate to contact us.

story:
Dan Lafayette passed away on Tuesday, October 23, 2012, following a short illness. He is survived by his  children, Amber Lea and Connor James Lafayette.

Besides his children, his greatest joy was when he was sitting behind a set of drums playing with many local bands. His friends and family have come together and planned a benefit concert for his children. Many local bands will be playing.


Since not all of us will be able to attend, this fundraiser is to contribute to the benefit. At the close of the fundraiser, all funds will go directly to the Community Bank in the kids' names.

story:
If you are having difficulties with Paypal, you can always send us an email at info@ecorunner.nl and we will help you.


Short Summary

We are a student team from Delft University of Technology, consisting of around 20 students, trying to build the most efficient hydrogen powered car in the world! We combine cutting-edge technology with creativity and engineering knowledge to build a vehicle we compete with in the annual Shell Eco-Marathon. 

The goal is to drive around 16 km and 25 km/h while using as little energy as possible. Last year we achieved a converted mileage of an astonishing 3653 km/L, that is from Delft to Southern Spain and back! 

Will you help us shatter this record and become world-champion of the Eco-Marathon?

What You Get

So, why did we start a crowdfunding campaign? We need your help! Over the past few months we have come up with a promising design, and now it's time to bring this design to life! 

Therefore we need materials, and for materials we need funds, and that's where you can help us! We'll also have to get our team and vehicle to London, where this year's race will be held. 

The goal of this campaign is to reach about 6.000, and we're hoping you can help us in that! By pledging money to our cause you will:

  • Contribute to the advancement of hydrogen fuel cell technology.
  • Help the realization of a 100 percent self-designed vehicle.
  • Help fund the limitless imagination of college students.
  • Help us become world champion this summer in London!
  • Show us that you support the hard work we put in every day!

The Impact

So, what will happen when you pledge money to us? Like we said, we'll put all this money towards the production, testing and transportation of our vehicle. The entire team has put their heart and soul into this design, we have five people working on the project full-time and many others spending almost all of their spare time at the office. We live and breathe Eco-Runner on a daily basis!

Nothing will be more rewarding for us than to see our design right here in our workshop and take it to London to compete against other universities! Last year we won the race, and we would love to defend our title this summer in London. Will you be able to say you helped us become world-champion by the end of the year?

Besides participating in the Eco-Marathon, part of our mission is to advance hydrogen fuel cell technology. Our team uses a prototype fuel cell, and the tests we perform throughout the year will help improve the future performance of this stack. This means that by backing our project you will also contribute to the zero-emission technology of the future, and who wouldn't want that?!

Challenges

To summarize this project in one word: challenging. The whole point of the project is to challenge the limits of our engineering, imagination and motivation, all in order to push the boundaries of technology. 

This project is a steep learning curve for all of us, which means not everything always goes according to plan. Designs can fail, parts can break, our motivation and perseverance will be tested. 

This is also what makes the project beautiful however, and because we are all so dedicated to the cause we are confident we'll overcome all of these challenges and have an award-winning vehicle at the end of the year!

Other Ways You Can Help

There is another way to help us, and it might even be more valuable than a financial contribution: your network of friends, family and associates! As the name implies, crowd funding campaigns live or die by one thing: a crowd. 

If you share our project on your social media channels and among your friends, and if your friends share it among their friends we'll cover half the world with our campaign, and if only a small percentage of all those people pledge something to our cause  well easily reach our goal!

So please, share our project amongst your friends, and we'll be eternally grateful!

More Information

For more information visit our website: www.ecorunner.nl
If you are having difficulties with Paypal, you can always send us an email at info@ecorunner.nl and we will help you.
story_txt:
If you are having difficulties with Paypal, you can always send us an email at info@ecorunner.nl and we will help you.


Short Summary

We are a student team from Delft University of Technology, consisting of around 20 students, trying to build the most efficient hydrogen powered car in the world! We combine cutting-edge technology with creativity and engineering knowledge to build a vehicle we compete with in the annual Shell Eco-Marathon. 

The goal is to drive around 16 km and 25 km/h while using as little energy as possible. Last year we achieved a converted mileage of an astonishing 3653 km/L, that is from Delft to Southern Spain and back! 
Will you help us shatter this record and become world-champion of the Eco-Marathon?   What You Get So, why did we start a crowdfunding campaign? We need your help! Over the past few months we have come up with a promising design, and now it's time to bring this design to life! 
Therefore we need materials, and for materials we need funds, and that's where you can help us! We'll also have to get our team and vehicle to London, where this year's race will be held. 
The goal of this campaign is to reach about 6.000, and we're hoping you can help us in that! By pledging money to our cause you will: 
Contribute to the advancement of hydrogen fuel cell technology.
Help the realization of a 100 percent self-designed vehicle.
Help fund the limitless imagination of college students.
Help us become world champion this summer in London!
Show us that you support the hard work we put in every day!    The Impact So, what will happen when you pledge money to us? Like we said, we'll put all this money towards the production, testing and transportation of our vehicle. The entire team has put their heart and soul into this design, we have five people working on the project full-time and many others spending almost all of their spare time at the office. We live and breathe Eco-Runner on a daily basis!
Nothing will be more rewarding for us than to see our design right here in our workshop and take it to London to compete against other universities! Last year we won the race, and we would love to defend our title this summer in London. Will you be able to say you helped us become world-champion by the end of the year?
Besides participating in the Eco-Marathon, part of our mission is to advance hydrogen fuel cell technology. Our team uses a prototype fuel cell, and the tests we perform throughout the year will help improve the future performance of this stack. This means that by backing our project you will also contribute to the zero-emission technology of the future, and who wouldn't want that?!
    Challenges To summarize this project in one word: challenging. The whole point of the project is to challenge the limits of our engineering, imagination and motivation, all in order to push the boundaries of technology. 
This project is a steep learning curve for all of us, which means not everything always goes according to plan. Designs can fail, parts can break, our motivation and perseverance will be tested. 
This is also what makes the project beautiful however, and because we are all so dedicated to the cause we are confident we'll overcome all of these challenges and have an award-winning vehicle at the end of the year!
    Other Ways You Can Help There is another way to help us, and it might even be more valuable than a financial contribution: your network of friends, family and associates! As the name implies, crowd funding campaigns live or die by one thing: a crowd. 
If you share our project on your social media channels and among your friends, and if your friends share it among their friends we'll cover half the world with our campaign, and if only a small percentage of all those people pledge something to our cause  well easily reach our goal!
So please, share our project amongst your friends, and we'll be eternally grateful!

More Information
For more information visit our website: www.ecorunner.nl

If you are having difficulties with Paypal, you can always send us an email at info@ecorunner.nl and we will help you.

story:
The Westmoor Broadcasting club was established based on two principals.  To spread the art of reporting and student journalism, and to unite students with a passion of broadcasting news and everything that goes behind it.  The purpose of this club is to grant students the opportunity to become journalists, camera operators, directors and producers.  High school is a time of self discovery and experimentation for many.  We go to school and perform a systematic set of tasks that are meant to teach us then go home.  We would like to enhance on that formula by creating an enjoyable experience available to students to prepare them for what could be their future profession.  There could be a student who has no interest at all in journalism but because they seized an opportunity to explore, they might fall in love with their future career.  Some of the projects we intend to do include but are not limited to: live news broadcasts, reports, online news articles, documentaries and short films.  

This campaign was created to generate a small amount to get this club moving.  Currently, we have one Canon T3i DSLR camera.  But, it takes much more to produce a high quality video.  We need a set of lavalier microphones, an audio recorder, a teleprompter, studio lighting,  different lenses, a tripod,licenses to video editing software and more.  Plus, we want to launch a website, so web hosting will be part of the cost. We have estimated that total starting costs will be about $500.  %100 of all funding will go  into purchasing equipment.  
Other than the obvious lack of technology, the only hurdle we have is putting in the effort to produce high quality broadcasts.  Rest assured that we have amassed a group of very bright, talented and dedicated individuals.  We are ready to tackle these obstacles and overcome them!  
 Contributing to this cause would mean the world to all the members in this club.  Because of your benevolence, generations of students get a unique hands-on experience that can not be replicated.  Not only that, we can also serve our school and community by producing top notch educational and informative videos that everyone can benefit from.  
If it is not possible for you to contribute,  then please spread the word!  Share this to anybody that you know who would be able to contribute.  Every dollar counts and is highly appreciated.  
Thank you! 

-The Westmoor Broadcasting Club

story:
Bonjour à tous!

Nous sommes quatre étudiantes de 16 à 17 ans. Aux mois de janvier et février prochains, nous partirons au Costa Rica avec l'organisme Global Crossroad pour venir en aide à de jeunes enfants démunis dans la ville d'Atenas. En effet, nous irons dans un centre pour enfants pour réaliser plusieurs activités avec les jeunes Costa Ricains pendant leurs vacances. Nous voulons d'abord et avant tout contribuer à améliorer leur situation de vie difficile principalement causée par le manque de ressources et la pauvreté auxquels ils sont confrontés. Ainsi, nous désirons apporter divers biens essentiels au sain développement des enfants (tels que des vêtements et du matériel scolaire), aider le village à se développer (travaux de construction) et apporter un soutien moral aux jeunes. 

Nos objectifs:

1. Enseignement de l'anglais, des arts, des mathématiques et de la musique aux jeunes Costa Ricains.
2. Don de vêtements et de matériel scolaire que nous avons amassés au Québec pour les enfants et expédiés au Costa Rica par avion.
3. Peindre une murale sur le mur de l'église de la communauté.
4. Écrire un livre pour enfants illustré de dessins réalisés par les enfants. Nous souhaitons publier le livre à notre retour au Québec afin d'envoyer les profits à Atenas, pour permettre au village de continuer  à améliorer la situation de leurs enfants, et leur assurer un avenir meilleur.
En bref, nous souhaitons améliorer la qualité de vie des orphelins d'Atenas et contribuer à leur réussite grâce à tous les moyens dont nous disposons.
Nous nous engageons envers tous nos donateurs à ce que vos dons aient un impact réel dans cette communauté.
 

Utilisation des dons

Tous vos dons iront dans:
  • L'achat des matériaux nécessaires à la confection de la murale (peinture, pinceaux, etc.)
  • La préparation et le transport des vêtements et des matériaux scolaires du Québec au Costa Rica
  • Achat de matériaux de construction 

D'autres façons d'aider

Encouragez-nous, suivez-nous, visitez-nous, partagez-nous, parlez de nous

Peu importe le geste, voici comment nous aider.

  • Faites un don, aussi petit soit-il. 
  • Vous pouvez partager, aimer, suivre... nos pages Facebook, Twitter, Instagram ainsi que notre site web avec votre entourage.
  • Partagez notre histoire par email
  • Nous donner des vêtements pour enfants dont vous n'avez plus besoin. 
  • Nous donner du matériel scolaire que vous avez en double, en triple, en quadruple... à la maison.

*Les dons seront faits au compte de Camille Peltier. Ne vous inquiétez pas! Ils seront bel et bien reçus par l'équipe Costa Rica 2015. En effet, c'est le compte PayPal d'une des membres de l'équipe.*

Vous verrez… ça fait du bien de faire du bien!

Un gros merci de toute l'équipe Costa Rica !
Audrey, Camille, Alexandrine et Brooke

story:
Breve reseña

En La Escuela de Inversión ofrecemos los atajos que utilizan los ricos para ganar el juego del dinero, te indicamos qué rutas hay y te preparamos para que diseñes tu propio plan personalizado de acción, para que consigas avanzar en la dirección que lleva donde quieres llegar.

Proyecto

Este proyecto nace con el objetivo de ayudar en la educación financiera inmobiliaria actual. Con este paradigma mundial en el que estamos envueltos, queremos crear un curso que ayude a la comprensión del mundo inmobiliario así como dar herramientas para que se puedan realizar operaciones inmobiliarias sin prácticamente dinero. Aprenderás a comprender el mercado, saber cómo evaluar una propiedad y conseguirás numerosas herramientas para adentrarte en el mundo inmobiliario.

Las recompensas



Transparencia

El proyecto se fundamenta en la creación conjunta y colaborativa de los inversores y seguidores de la escuela de inversión de su propio curso,  es interesante expandir esta idea y queremos ofrecer esta posibilidad a todo el mundo que le guste el mundo de la inversión y la educación financiera.

Conócenos

La Escuela de Inversión lleva desde el 2008 tratando de acercar la educación financiera a la gente corriente, tal y como reza su eslogan, hemos creado cursos de distintas familias de inversión tales como desarrollo personal, bolsa, bienes raíces o inmuebles. La comunidad de la Escuela de Inversión se compone de más de 5.500 y continuamente estamos haciendo eventos y creando sinergias entre profesionales del sector para acercarle a todo el mundo la educación financiera.
www.laescueladeinversion.com es el portal de difusión propio con gran afluencia, además al ser un portal educativo, divulgativo y de formación tenemos muchos colaboradores que apoyarán la causa. Estimamos poder llegar a 20.000 personas en suma de todas las personas que nos visiten.

Objetivos y premios

Queremos premiaros por compartir, por ser cada día más grandes y vamos a fijar tres objetivos para motivar a todo aquel que quiera participar.

- Si llegamos a 6.000€ enviaremos a cada mecenas un polo oficial de La Escuela de Inversión.

- Si llegamos a 12.000€ enviaremos también un cuaderno/libreta de La Escuela de Inversión y una carta de agradecimiento.

- Si llegamos a 20.000€ realizaremos en el mes de febrero una masterclass por nuestro formador Juan Haro titulada "técnicas vender un inmuebles en menos de 60 días"


Difunde y lo conseguiremos

Tenemos mucha ilusión, estamos renovando desde dentro la educación financiera y hemos aportado esencia nueva a un tipo de conocimiento que deberían enseñarnos desde pequeños y no se hace. La Escuela de Inversión nació como un proyecto  cuya premisa inicial era la creación de una comunidad a la que poder formar en la educación financiera que tanto hace falta en la gente corriente , desde 0€. El proyecto lleva creciendo desde su fundación, tú eres parte de La Escuela de Inversión, difunde este proyecto y llegaremos a los objetivos, ¿colaboras?

story:
Join Us in Launching Our New School 

This year our school closed its doors and left us without a place to go. We have several students that have social disorders, need one-on-one attention, and have mild autism. These students have come from many different backgrounds that include public schools and homeschools.

"Our teacher decided that she could not see her students have to go to a new school and make new friends. So she decided to homeschool some of us. Soon parents got word of this and wanted in. Next thing we know we have 30 students that did not want to go back to public school."

So a few parents got together and decided to start a school for the students - Nest Academy Utah. We have most of what we need except a building and school starts in just a few short weeks.

We are not under the umbrella of any church so that we can better meet the needs of the families that come from all different denominations and religious backgrounds.

What Have We Done So Far?

We have obtained our corporation and built a board that consists of teachers, parents, and local business owners. We have our bylaws and paper work ready to be filed with the 501(c)(3) at the IRS. We have desks, chairs, chalkboards, computers, students, and teachers. We have found a building that we like...

What Will Funds be used for?

Our goal is to raise enough money to pay for the deposit and lease for the first few months. In addition, we will need to cover monthly expenses as we continue to build our student body. These expenses will include remodeling, art supplies, and pay for our 501(c)(3) application. 

                                     

How Can You Help?

First and foremost, we welcome your dollars! There are costs associated with both launching and seeding a fruitful, long-term venture like this! (Did we mention we are thinking BIG? We want to grow in our community as a safe place for our kids to go to school.)

Second, we would love your help getting the word out that Nest Academy Utah is here in Salt Lake City. We cannot be everywhere and we do not know everyone who will want to be involved, so we really need your help. Sharing on Facebook, Twitter, G+ or your favorite online or real-life networks of choice increases our chances of getting our building in time for school to start this season. Otherwise, our students will have no where to go.

What Happens if We Do not Meet Our Goal?

All funds will go toward the school, Nest Academy Utah, whether we reach our goal or not.

                               

The Impact

We really believe that this is what God will have us do! Many children’s education is counting on our school to start and we are trusting that the funds will be there in time.

Our students have not had a positive educational experience in other school atmospheres and have grown and flourished in our care. We have been able to teach them the importance of education in a family atmosphere. Our goal is to help these children become lifelong learners in spite of their learning disabilities, social disabilities, or bad experiences in education.

We have a vision to strengthen the family unit by offering after hour courses that will teach our parents and the community how to succeed. We strongly believe in partnering with the parents to create as firm a foundation at home as they have at school.

You can learn more about Nest Academy Utah by visiting our website

http://nestacademyutah.com/

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please help us get the word out and send this event invitation to everyone you know.
  • Please use the share tools on the Indiegogo site to make it easier for you.

story:
What this Project is About

Hello and THANK YOU for coming to our campaign page!  Have you watched the video yet, posted above?  It's only 2 minutes long but it gives a good explanation of our project  I'm definitely not a movie star, but hopefully my message will be clear and you'll come away feeling that this is something you really want to be a part of.

I’m currently in the process of starting a vocational trade school in Mendoza, Argentina – it’s called Juntos Argentina (“juntos” is the Spanish word for “together”).  The school will be exclusively for lower class youth, and we will be teaching skills such as welding, auto repair, construction (carpentry, electrician, etc.) and commercial driving.  Our website gives a great explanation of everything --- www.JuntosArgentina.com

Juntos Argentina urgently needs to make a video, for use when meeting with people and organizations for donations, as well as recruiting potential board members.  I could talk for hours about the need for the school, but a video will have a lot more impact:

  • Alfredo and Fabian talking about how the courses will teach them a technical skill that will open the doors of employment opportunities and help them to rise out of poverty
  • Business owners explaining how providing technical education to the poor will provide them will skilled workers
  • Community leaders commenting on how this type of education will benefit the families, communities, and country

People often ask me what they can do to help Juntos Argentina, because they see the great value in providing education to poor youth, especially education that will directly result in employment and rising out of poverty.  Well, here's a simple, concrete way that you can help, and you'll know that the money is going directly to what you're donating for, and not for some administrative costs.  DONATE TO HELP MAKE A DIFFERENCE!

What We Need & What You Get

To make a professional video, a videographer and I need to travel to Mendoza, Argentina and film various people, organizations, and locations.  The filming will take approximately five days, and the money needed will cover air fare, lodging, food, the videographer’s production fee, miscellaneous production costs, and the fee for editing what we film and make a finished, polished video.  A total of $9750 is needed for this video project, and friends have already donated $2500, so $7250 is still needed.  Normally a video like this would cost $30-40,000 but the videographer (Victor) believes strongly in Juntos and is giving us a great discount in his fees.

Together (“juntos”) we can make this video project a reality!  And...you’ll receive some cool perks like a postcard from Argentina or delicious empanadas - check them out on the right side of this page.  Please consider making a donation so that the video can be made and Juntos Argentina will be able to move forward with providing valuable education to lower class youth in Argentina.  Alfredo, Fabian, and thousands of youths like them will be so grateful that you care enough to make a difference in their lives!

Other Ways You Can Help

Naturally, I’d be extremely grateful if you decide to make a donation.  Just as important though is to get the word out to your network of friends, family, co-workers, church, groups/clubs, Facebook, LinkedIn, twitter, blogs, etc.  This is a campaign, and we have a maximum of 30 days on this site to raise the funds.  So if you’re interested in taking an extra step and help spread the word, please send out a group email, or post on your Facebook, or whatever you can think of to get people to visit this page!  AND please “Like” us on the Facebook icon above this summary – that will help us so much!  The more times people view this page and “Like” it, and donate, the more prominent it will be displayed on Indiegogo and attract others who will want to donate.

Again, THANKS SO MUCH for deciding to help Juntos Argentina!

p.s. - feel free to contact me directly - Paul@JuntosArgentina.com / 303-202-2636 - with any questions, comments or concerns.
story_txt:
What this Project is About
Hello and THANK YOU for coming to our campaign page!  Have you watched the video yet, posted above?  It's only 2 minutes long but it gives a good explanation of our project  I'm definitely not a movie star, but hopefully my message will be clear and you'll come away feeling that this is something you really want to be a part of.
I’m currently in the process of starting a vocational trade school in Mendoza, Argentina – it’s called Juntos Argentina (“juntos” is the Spanish word for “together”).  The school will be exclusively for lower class youth, and we will be teaching skills such as welding, auto repair, construction (carpentry, electrician, etc.) and commercial driving.  Our website gives a great explanation of everything --- www.JuntosArgentina.com
Juntos Argentina urgently needs to make a video, for use when meeting with people and organizations for donations, as well as recruiting potential board members.  I could talk for hours about the need for the school, but a video will have a lot more impact:

Alfredo and Fabian talking about how the courses will teach them a technical skill that will open the doors of employment opportunities and help them to rise out of poverty

story:
Wooden Shoe Books Needs Your Help!

Wooden Shoe Books has been in Philadelphia since 1976. The Shoe, as it is sometimes called, primarily operates as an infoshop, meaning that we function as a space where people gather, learn, and share ideas, news, and events related to our local radical communities. The infoshop is solely sustained by the passion of our volunteers. Functioning within a system we oppose, we seek to be an example of one way people can work together to challenge dominant power structures. As a collective, we do not have a boss or managers, but rather all of the decisions in the space are made through consensus by collective members and volunteers to empower everyone involved in the space to have a voice.

This past year has been tough on us. We are currently short on volunteers, and our core group has been stretched thin. We depend on sales and donations to ensure that we can pay the rent and other costs, and the winter months are particularly rough on us every year. As the collective is undergoing a much overdue restructuring, shifting our focus away from finances would allow us to focus on more important issues, such as building a stronger sense of community.


What We Need

Your contribution would allow us to address many projects and issues, including but not limited to:

  • Installing a new, internal accessibility ramp
  • Replacing our old, incredibly heavy storefront grates
  • Electrical/lighting repair and refinishing our floor
  • Upgrading our computers and electronics to be able to handle today's internet/technological thresholds
  • Assurance for the collective's financial health during the winter months
  • A fresh face--new coats of paint, refinished floors, shelf replacements, etc.
  • Continuing to expand our inventory and purchasing new items
  • Focusing more on community-building and trainings

Our detailed budget is:

  • $2,500 - Internal accessibility ramp
  • $3,000 - New storefront grates
  • $4,800 - Electrical/lighting repair
  • $3,000 - New computers and monitors
  • $300 - Replace broken sound equipment
  • $5,400 - 12 months of new point of sale system software
  • $4,000 - Labor and materials to redo shelves
  • $2,000 - Loss of revenue when closed for remodeling
  • TOTAL: $25,000

The Impact

  • Giving our space a much needed facelift to ensure a welcoming and comfortable environment for many years to come
  • Making our space more available to our Philadelphia communities
  • Allowing our core contingent of volunteers the time and resources needed to revitalize the internal structure of the collective
  • Enabling us to redirect our energy away from surviving as a retail operation on South Street, toward participating in solidarity economy and supporting local creators

Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways to support Wooden Shoe Books & Records' campaign in addition to donating:

  • Get the word out! Forward this page to your friends, family, and anyone you think would be interested.
  • Buy a book (or bag of coffee beans, poster, or radical patches/buttons)! We are open at 704 South Street from 12 am - 10 pm mostly every day. You can also visit our website here: http://woodenshoebooks.com/home.html and follow us on Facebook and Instagram
  • Volunteer with us! We are entirely run by over 25 volunteers. Come by to fill out a volunteer application.

Thank You!

With your support, The Wooden Shoe will continue to thrive and create space for radical learning and activism in Philadelphia for years to come. Thank you for believing in our project and supporting our community center!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jordan King and I am a volunteer teacher and head football coach on the little island of Elbow Cay, Abaco, Bahamas. Due to a lack of after school activities, we have partnered with the Abaco Youth Football Association (AYFA) in order to introduce the first ever youth football team to our little Island. The Bull Sharks is a flag football team, broken down into three age groups who compete with three other Abaco Islands. Our PeeWees are 6-9yrs old, our Juniors are 10-13, and our seniors are 14-17.

What We Need

Because this is out first year participating in the league, we are beginning from scratch. It is our hope that through fundraising, we can raise enough money to allow all island kids to participate in the sport, regardless of their ability to pay. Between team fees, player fees, insurance, uniforms, equipment and travel costs, we estimate that our start up cost to participate in the 2014-2015 season will be between $5,000 and $5,500.

The Impact

Introducing a football program to the island of Hopetown will a) provide youth with a positive way to spend their free time, b) introduce them to a sport which many have no knowledge of, c) provided much needed exercise for children who do not receive a regular PE program, and d) teach children the benefits of cooperation and being part of a team.

Risks & Challenges

Although all sports carry with them  a certain degree or risk, flag football is considered a non-contact sport. In addition, coaches go out of their way to  ensure proper training in flag pulling and blocking, thus further reducing the chances of injury. Should an injury occur, each player is covered by personal medical insurance which will cover the costs of any necessary medical care.

Other Ways You Can Help

As of right now, the Bullsharks are in desperate need of funds in order to cover insurance costs, player fees, uniform costs and transportation to and from away games. Currently some coaches have spent their own money in order to purchase basic equipment, but we are currently training with rubber balls, and need funding in order for there to be any chance of the Bull Sharks being competitive in the coming months and years.

story:
Background to the trip

I am the Physics teacher at Gateway High School, located in San Francisco.  Gateway is an inner-city public charter school, focused towards students with learning differences. Our student population reflects the ethnic and cultural diversity of the city of San Francisco.

One component of Gateway’s unique education style is our Project Week.  Project week takes place in January and the courses that are being offered reflect the interests and skills of the staff. 

My course is called the Physics of Snowsports.  The main goals of the course will be; expanding horizons, taking students out of their comfort zone and the city and trying something completely new. Students will study the fundamental physics principles behind various snow-sport then drive up to Tahoe  for 3 days to try sledding, ice skating, tubing and finally snowboarding.

The Students

Gateway High School serves approximately 450 economically, racially, ethnically, and intellectually diverse high school students (grades 9-12) from the San Francisco community and the surrounding Bay Area.

Of 14 students enrolled in this course, nearly all of them have never seen snow.  This will be an amazing opportunity for them to experience Tahoe and a chance to open up some of the world that they have never seen. Over the 9 years that I have done this many of the former students credit the trip with giving them the confidence to travel for college, study abroad or even living abroad.

What we need

A trip such as this is beyond the budget of most of our students but through generous donations of parents, alumni and teachers we are able to provide transport, snow clothing, food and accommodation for the students.

We need help to raise money so they can take part in the snow activities whilst they are in Tahoe. Thanks to Sugar Bowl Resort we are able to get a day of Snow Boarding with rentals and lift passes for just $50 per student. We would also like to take them tubing and even ice skating.

Please consider helping give these students an experience they'll never forget.

story:
Please Support China's First Orphan Hospice 

Our doors are the ones that are open when every other has been shut. Our children come to us when all hope has been lost, but that's exactly what we give. Hope. Care and Love.

We've done it! With just under a day to go we've raised our target of $30,000!

We've been so overwhelmed by the generosity and support shown by people around the world! And we wanted to say a heartfelt thank you to each and every supporter who's donated to our campaign. 


Our Mission: Love and care for our children

We are an international charity dedicated to providing palliative care to orphaned, abandoned and very sick babies and children in China. Some are only with us for a day. Others have gone on to have life changing surgery and have been adopted by loving families.

Working in co-operation with the Chinese government we provide loving care and treatment for children with life-threatening illnesses. No matter how small or how sick, we give every baby the love, care and medical attention they need.

But we need to do more. We are in desperate need of donations to fund even more care at our two Butterfly Hospices in Changsha and Nanjing.

These lives are fragile, these days are precious.Your support gives our children a fighting chance.


Every child deserves a chance. To be known and to be loved. Together with your help we can reach even more families, provide even more care, and give every child the right to a life full of meaning.

Campaign Goal and Fund Usage 

We need to raise $30,000 so we can continue this life changing work. We need to continue with our many services and develop our community outreach even further to reach families in need before the heart-breaking moment of abandonment. We believe that with good support, respite care and access to medical services, many families would not have to make this devastating choice. 

Every dollar raised from this campaign will be spent directly on our two care homes in Nanjing and Changsha.

Every donation, no matter how small, can help to keep our doors open. So we can say yes to every sick or abandoned child who comes to us. No child should have to face these struggles alone. Please donate today and be a part of their journey. 

For every wonderful supporter who donates to our campaign we will create a named butterfly collage on a wall in one of our Butterfly homes. Photos of the wall will be posted on our blog after the campaign has ended. 



Donations

If you can donate $50 you'll receive a digital print of one of our butterfly handprint photos — made by our very own butterfly children. With a $75 donation you will receive a special butterfly knot as well as the above. If you make a $250 donation you'll receive a personalised framed digital butterfly handprint photo to hang in your home! 

We are very excited to announce that for our supporters who can donate $1000 or more you will receive a signed, original scroll picture by Anthony Seng Cheong. You can read more about Anthony and his work here. 

To all our supporters we thank you, from the bottom of our hearts. 


Charity information

UK Registered Charity 1116192

Australian Inc. Assoc. A0054338J

Hong Kong BCH Foundation Ltd Cert. of Inc. 1722724

US Federal Tax ID 47-1880456

Changsha Home (business license 070274): 

长沙蝴蝶之家儿童临终护理中心 (湘长民政字第070274号)

Nanjing Home (business license 070840): 

南京市蝴蝶之家重症儿童安护中心 (苏宁民证字第070840号)


FAQ

What percentage of the funds will go towards caring for the children?

All of the funds except what Indiegogo deducts.


Is my donation tax deductible?

Unfortunately, as Indiegogo only allows campaign funds to be transferred to one of the global Butterfly Hospices entitles, only funds given by UK residents will attract a tax benefit through this campaign. If you would like to enquire about tax deductable donations from countries outside of UK.  Please contact info@butterflych.org for details.

I'm having trouble making a donation

Please read Indiegogo's troubleshooting page here to see commonly asked questions about the donation process. If you are still unable to make a donation please contact info@butterflych.org . 


When will I receive my donation “Perk”?

We will be sending them out after the conclusion of our campaign in December.


Have even more questions?

Leave a comment or send a message to info@butterflych.org

story:
La Abolición del Ejército es uno de los acontecimientos más importantes en la historia de Costa Rica.

Vivir sin la presencia de fuerzas armadas define una específica manera de vivir en libertad, la cual resulta imperceptible para el pueblo costarricense. Sólo nos damos cuenta de ello cuando visitamos otros países que, aunque democráticos, ostentan su poderío militar mediante actos absolutamente desconocidos y extraños para nosotros: patrullajes, desfiles, armamentos… La inexistencia constitucional de fuerzas castrenses también ha permitido al Estado de Costa Rica dedicar el dinero que correspondería al mantenimiento de un ejército a invertir en salud, educación y programas de bienestar social. Con ello Costa Rica ha alcanzado índices de desarrollo humano comparables con los de los países ricos.

Por esas razones, el Centro Cultural e Histórico José Figueres Ferrer celebra la fecha en que Don Pepe dio ese paso visionario y  grandioso con el concurso Costa Rica un país sin ejército. Se pretende con ello mantener la conciencia de lo importante de ese acto en la vida nacional y resaltar los ideales del único general victorioso de la historia que elimina las armas para convertirlas en instrumentos de paz, y al mismo tiempo se estimula la creatividad, la investigación y la lectura acerca de este acontecimiento histórico​

Durante 17 años hemos realizado el concurso en distintas modalidades: dibujo, poesía, ensayo, cuento, ​retahíla, caricatura, afiche, entre otros, ​y para diferentes categorías: niños, jóvenes, adultos, profesionales. Este año 2014 la modalidad escogida es la escultura y las categorías son infantil, juvenil, adulto, profesional. Las bases del concurso están en la página www.centrojosefigueres.org

Colabora ya con la celebración Costa Rica un país sin ejército.

El Centro Cultural e Histórico José Figueres Ferrer en San Ramón de Alajuela, celebra la abolición del ejercito el 1ro de diciembre.  

Sus donaciones permitirán al centro realizar el concurso, beneficiando directamente a más de 200 personas y creando conciencia en la población sobre los beneficios de vivir sin la presencia de fuerzas armadas y la importancia global que esto representa para Costa Rica.

Formas para ayudar:

1.  Con tu tarjeta de crédito a través www.indiegogo.com/‎

2.  A través de las plataformas electrónicas de los principales bancos del país:
Banco Nacional

Céd jurídica 3-006-199035

Fundación pro Centro Cultural e Histórico José Figueres

al para enviarte un mensajero
story_txt:
La
Abolición del Ejército es uno de los acontecimientos más importantes en la
historia de Costa Rica.
Vivir sin la presencia de fuerzas
armadas define una específica manera de vivir en libertad, la cual resulta
imperceptible para el pueblo costarricense. Sólo nos damos cuenta de ello
cuando visitamos otros países que, aunque democráticos, ostentan su poderío
militar mediante actos absolutamente desconocidos y extraños para
nosotros: patrullajes, desfiles, armamentos… La inexistencia constitucional
de fuerzas castrenses también ha permitido al Estado de Costa Rica dedicar el
dinero que correspondería al mantenimiento de un ejército a invertir en salud,
educación y programas de bienestar social. Con ello Costa Rica ha alcanzado
índices de desarrollo humano comparables con los de los países ricos.
Por esas razones, el Centro
Cultural e Histórico José Figueres Ferrer celebra la fecha en que Don Pepe dio
ese paso visionario y  grandioso con el concurso Costa Rica un país sin ejército.
Se pretende con ello mantener la conciencia de lo importante de ese acto en la
vida nacional y resaltar los ideales del único general victorioso de la
historia que elimina las armas para convertirlas en instrumentos de paz, y
al mismo tiempo se estimula la creatividad, la investigación y la lectura
acerca de este acontecimiento histórico​
Durante 17 años hemos
realizado el concurso en distintas modalidades: dibujo, poesía, ensayo, cuento,
​retahíla, caricatura, afiche, entre otros, ​y para diferentes categorías:
niños, jóvenes, adultos, profesionales. Este año 2014 la modalidad escogida es
la escultura y las categorías son infantil, juvenil, adulto, profesional.
Las bases del concurso están en la página www.centrojosefigueres.org
Colabora ya con la celebración Costa Rica un país sin ejército. 
El Centro Cultural e Histórico José Figueres Ferrer en San Ramón de
Alajuela, celebra la abolición del ejercito el 1ro de diciembre.  
Sus donaciones permitirán al centro realizar el concurso, beneficiando directamente
a más de 200 personas y creando conciencia en la población sobre los beneficios
de vivir sin la presencia de fuerzas armadas y la importancia global que esto
representa para Costa Rica. 
Formas para ayudar:
1. 
Con tu tarjeta de crédito a
través www.indiegogo.com/‎
2. 
A través de las plataformas
electrónicas de los principales bancos del país:
Banco Nacional
100-01-000-198014-3
Céd jurídica 3-006-199035 
Fundación pro Centro
Cultural e Histórico José Figueres
3. 
Contactándonos al  2447-2178 o info@centrojosefigueres.org
al para enviarte un mensajero

story:
Who we are?

My name is Samantha Staude. I have a husband named Tom and two children Brady and Elena. I began looking for care for my first child to go back to work and found myself struggling to find a center that met my needs. After searching for a center my husband and I decided it would be best if I was quite my job and become a stay at home mom. After staying at home with my first we found out 9 months later that I was pregnant again with our second child. After having my second child I decided to watch a few children out of my house to allow my children to have the socialization and company of other children. About 9 months into this experiment I came across a place in Lake Mills,WI that was a small store and thought maybe I could start my own Reggio Inspired Preschool and childcare center in this facility. 

After doing research I found out that one of two largest child care center in that area had just shut down. I knew at that moment I might have a great opportunity to bring something special to the community. With a emphasis on Reggio Inspired Classroom and Materials I then began to add in the Organic and Non GMO foods, Yoga classes,Cooking classes, lots of community involvement events  and Eco-friendly Materials (toys and structures) that would compliment the demand that I found in the Lake Mills Area.  

What We Need & What You Get

We are approved for an SBA loan of 80,000 but would love to get rid of the debt as soon as possible to build a new facility in the future that would accommodate a large group size of children. 


    The Impact

    Having this new Reggio Inspired Preschool will bring:

    • the community closer to the involvement of the younger generation
    • future job growth for teachers and staff
    • Allow for the families to socialize and become more connected with the community

story:
My name is Jason Huska. I will be studying abroad in Tanzania this summer through the University of Illinois, and I am campaigning to raise funds to purchase items from the Amani Children's Home wish list.

Amani Children’s Home is committed to reducing the number of children living on the streets in Tanzania by providing a nurturing place for homeless children to heal, grow, and learn. In addition to providing long-term care, Amani aims to reunite children with their relatives when possible and to equip their families with the tools they need to be self-sustainable. Amani is dedicated to creating a path for each child that leads to a future filled with hope.

I am very excited for the opportunity to personally deliver these items to the children while in nearby Arusha!

Please consider sharing this page with others. If you prefer to collect items or make donations directly to me, feel free to contact me at 847-769-3395 or by e-mail at huska2@illinois.edu.

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Hillcrest is a vibrantly diverse elementary school of 480 students in southeast San Francisco.  Over half of our students are on campus from 7:50 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. each day and THIS is their playground.  They deserve better.  Our hope is to transform more than 5000 sq ft of cracked asphalt into a creatively designed and safe play space with an incredible turf soccer field as it's center piece. 

With a strong investment in community, health, wellness, and academics, America SCORES has been an ideal after-school offering for students on campus for the last 12 years.  This partnership has blossomed and spread over the years with the help of their expert soccer coach Rudy Osorio, who has gone from coaching three hard-to-defeat SCORES teams, to becoming a full-time staff physical education instructor and icon in the neighborhood and soccer community. 

Hillcrest has created an environment rich in learning opportunities for both the mind and body.  Recreation and sport are valued for the inherent health and social benefits. In fact, each Thursday the school hosts pick-up soccer games for all the parents!  Principal Richard Zapien would like to expand these safe, fun, and physical opportunities by taking the game outdoors to a new school micro-field. 

“Hillcrest has some of the worst, crumbled, hardscape.  The important thing about this project is that it is offering a place to play that is appropriate and safe.  We’re asking for your help.  We really need this for our kids… GOLAZO! “ –Principal Richard Zapien

With your donations and advocacy, this new Rudy Osorio Field of Dreams can become a reality! 

Pitch in!  Just $15 will install one square foot of turf and contribute to the legacy that Coach Rudy has instilled in the Hillcrest community: soccer, poetry, health, and hope.  $5,000 of community funding and more gets us closer to the total $60,000 needed to break ground this summer and have a new field to present to every student at the first day of school on August 18th, 2014!  We need your help to make this dream come true for our community.

story:
The News=200% Funded

Hi, thanks to Mr. awesome you and loads of your awesome friends, we GOT what we needed- the iMac for making IOS and Swift videos. So, aren't you wondering? why's this campaign still open?

What we'll do with 200% Funds?

Get a better iMac with SSD to record videos at a better quality,

What is Remaining Now?

Yes, Its That disastrous iPhone

IOS has stuff like Maps, Camera APIs, video & other media stuff, sensors which cannot be run inside an emulator. We need an iPhone for this...

What is the iPhone cost in India?

Its 1200-1500$! Are you serious? In America its just 649-749-849$ !!! Why should I fund you?

Why Not Parcel an iPhone directly from US?

Sure, why not? If you can do that kinda funding, we would WORSHIP you. We are not very religious but can surely build a shrine for you here :).

What Will I Do For You?

Ahan, now you've come to the interesting part. 

  1. From personally designed quick reference material to all my Android resources to PERSONALLY ASSISTING you in your project, I have a lot of perks to offer, check out my perks :)
  2. I will give you a personally designed Quick Reference material for Swift and other programming languages. I'll also offer 100% free coupons to my upcoming Udemy courses in 2015 as a perk.
  3. I would give you the resources I use for Android or IOS or both depending on the appropriate perk you select above.
  4. Most of all, I'll give you the best IOS and Swift videos you can see anywhere.


What are my goody-goodies
  1. Swift Goody-Goodies
  2. Basics,Variables,Operators,Control Statements,Functions,Closures,Optionals,Classes,Structures,Properties,Enumerations,Arrays,Dictionaries,Tuples,Protocols & Extensions,Generics and many more things as we build the videos...

  1. IOS Goody-Goodies

  1. Basics of using Xcode,Single Page applications,UI framework in IOS,Adaptive Layouts,Multi Page applications,UITableView and how you can play with it,TabBars ,CollectionViews,Settings,CoreData, SQLite,iCloud based persistence,Multithreading,Core Graphics Framework,Sprites,Touch and Gestures,Sensors,Maps,internationalization,Examples everywhere 
  2. Thats right my geeky brothers, no more theory blah blah blah...only PRACTICALITY with a tone of NEUTRALITY
