story:
WHAT IF THERE WERE NO NEED FOR VIOLENCE PREVENTION?
We have an answer!

Bullying ​and violence ​among ​kids and ​you​th hasn't gone away.  In fact it's getting​ worse!  ​A​nd ​it begin​s​ as early as kindergarten and doesn’t let up​.... ​It continues through high school and beyond.  Bullying,​ and most shockingly, suicides, among children and youth of all ages and backgrounds​ are being reported from all over the country.​ This is true for racially and gender motivated hate behavior also.

The effects are devastating​ and result in​ school absenteeism, truancy, dropping out and increased gang involvement: gangs ​replace broken family ties, ​and lead to ​more violence.

What Kids Create Peace Does 

  • We coach children  in learning essential life skills, (e.g. discernment; non-aggressive, non-oppositional communication; deep listening; critical thinking and leadership).

  • We assist them to discover and be free of limiting or negative concepts and beliefs, and to perceive, speak, and act without judgments that are reactions to the  beliefs or actions of others.

  • And to understand conflict: how it arises and how to prevent it. We provide tools of behavior to resolve conflicts and expand peacemaking skills of children and youth.

  • We strengthen their connection with, and commitment to their family, friends, teachers and other adults, their school and community.

  • We engage children with their families, schools and community in creating an enjoyable learning experience of caring individuals who model positive behavior and meaningful interactions.

  • We instill the pursuit and enjoyment of academic excellence that results from increased self-worth and self-esteem.

Watch our short video! (Above) You’ll hear some of the kids we’ve worked with share how KCP built their confidence, their respect for others – and themselves; their desire and ability to cooperate, and create together.

Your participation will help that happen for at least 300 more 'miracle' kids this next school year!

  • Our Demographic  
    Our kids come mostly from low income families (75%) and middle income (25%); many with difficult or harsh living conditions; i.e. single parent family or with both parents working; 60% non-English speaking; some with gang-active household members. 

  • The Mission of non-profit “Kids Create Peace”:  to provide children and youth the understanding and skills to change conflict into opportunities for positive  outcomes, and to achieve academic proficiency.

    Kids Create Peace (KCP)     is a program of One Voice of Peace, our 501 C-3 non-profit educational corporation registered in the states of Washington and California.  All donated funds go directly to supporting KCP and its operations.

Where does this happen?

Right now, it’s in Southern California’s Coachella Valley.  Its pilot year in 2011-2012, in one elementary school in Palms Springs, brought invitations to four schools for the next year. 

  • This school year, KCP has been invited to six elementary schools , one Boys & Girls Club, and is adding one Middle School.  Principals of other schools are interested, but like most schools, they don’t (yet) have the funding.
  • Since its pilot year working with 5th graders, KCP has added 3rd, 4th, and 6th grade.

   

KCP’s future:   

 One Voice of Peace plans to take KCP  Valley-wide in two years, state-wide in three years and nation-wide in five. 

 

KCP’s magical methodology

Consistency: We’re with these students, for one hour a week for 20 weeks, during or after the school day.  A variety of methods stir the students' interest:  discussion, journaling, video clips, skits, students’ presentations, games, role-playing, and dyads – (where the kids face one on one, often with someone they didn’t yet know very well, and speak with honesty on a topic of importance to both.) And as one of our kids said, “It’s the first time I felt someone was really listening to me”

             

With all these methods, the kids have direct experience of the changes they can easily make:  in relationships, circumstances and events.  This empowers them to bring what they now understand, to all areas of their lives! 

We’ve learned from parents’ “before” and “after” surveys that parents truly see the changes in their children’s attitude and behavior – that increases harmony in their home-life (which is all too often very stressful these days).

What we need – And what you receive

We need your participation!  We can’t do this by ourselves.  This is a national cause:  helping our young people become the best they can be, by starting early in life, with the support they need and deserve.

As you may know, most schools have little or no money for these “extra” programs.  This is why we are inviting you to join us in raising money, so we can provide our KCP program free of cost to the schools that lack funds for these programs.

What you’ll receive:

  • The realization that you are directly involved in changing lives – for the better! 
  • And you’ll also be able to sign up for a thank you gift from us – some of which are shown here – related to the size of your contribution.
  • $5 - $250 – Your name on list of supporters on OVP’s website
  • $250 - $500 (Same as above) & Choice of any one gift
  • $500 & above – Combo totaling three items plus your name on website list
    (PLEASE CHECK PREFERENCES)

                                   

  • Your contribution confirms you are part of KCP's  journey to become world-wide.

You’ll be able to look back, as years pass, and know that you were part of getting One Voice of Peace, its programs and  benefits more widely known. 

Get on board and help make KCP reach children and youth and their families nation-wide and in many other countries.  Imagine what it will be like to have people everywhere able to resolve differences and disagreements, even conflict – into peaceful, productive outcomes!  Isn’t this one of our highest of human visions?

                                                           

Indiegogo’s role in raising money:

Given the size of this vision, we are not asking for much money at this time.  Our goal now is $80,000 – enough to cover KCP's basic expenses for the upcoming school year.

Budget Highlights:

  KCP Program costs:  for 20 weeks, in 6 venues, each with 2 classes (units) 

  $6,712 each school  (or $3,356 per unit, e.g. 6th grade or B&G Club) 

Cost covers:

  • 3 Lead Facilitators, 3 Co-facilitators
  • 2 Program Developers
  • Website Maintenance
  • Accounting
  • Supplies
  • Equipment
  • Insurance                            

 Methodology:

Kids Create Peace is a 20-week, one hour per week, after school session, and explores how conflict begins:  the cultural assumptions and judgments that cause separation, prejudice, and hostility.

  • The program introduces a set of concepts, to be understood and applied through experiential, “anchoring” activities, such as games, role-playing and short videos; written material, like songs, poetry, plays, speeches, quotes, and newspaper and magazine articles. These are chosen and used in ways that allow students to see how patterns of judgmental behavior and conditioned thinking create unwanted “drama”, trauma and stress in their lives – and in the lives of those around them.
  • Students learn the value of ‘journaling’ (recording their thoughts about class discussions and important things they can share with family members.)
  • We share a few moments of ‘mindfulness’ quiet time at the beginning of each session to ease stress, and set up a relaxed environment.
  • We demonstrate how easy it is to cooperate, appreciate each other (including our diversity), and to create together. Kids and youth directly experience the positive changes they can create in relationships, circumstances and events. Thus they experience themselves as peacemakers!

In summer seminars, school breaks, etc., teachers and other educators are trained in the program’s ideas and in use of its materials.  All are independently funded, therefore no added expense for school systems.

Benefits of Kids Create Peace:

This program teaches kids and youth how to get along, to appreciate each other, to work together from mutual respect. This means it encourages and supports these results:Keep children and youth out of trouble.

♦ Reduce conflict and violence – among each other, and within their family      
   environment.

♦ Replace bullying with friendship.

♦ School is more fun.  No fear of being confronted or challenged in halls, rest rooms, lunch rooms, playgrounds, or even in the classroom.

♦ Academic proficiency.  Without class disruptions (note-sending to each other,    
   interrupting the teacher or another classmate, snacking during class – reported by teachers early in KCP’s time in schools) – the teacher’s presentations are heard, and students know they will be too, when they participate in class discussions.

♦ Each child feels respected, has confidence that their unique self is seen and
  appreciated.

♦ Their different learning styles are supported

♦ Teachers are no longer distracted by behavior problems, and can devote their time and energy to their true passion:helping kids learn and thrive, intellectually, socially, emotionally

Tools and skills acquired:

♦ Responsibility ♦ Accountability ♦ Deeper listening ♦ Critical thinking ♦ Appreciation of their own and others’ feelings ♦ Self-esteem ♦ Creativity ♦ Empowerment: experience of being “in charge of oneself”– able to affect  situations in a positive way -- despite any conditions in their lives ♦ Social responsibility ♦ Leadership

In summary:  Greater opportunity for academic success – a key to moving up the ladder to a successful and fulfilling life.

Youth Leadership:

+  Currently in development, is an expanded extension of Kids Create Peace. 

We are developing a two-level Youth Leadership/Mentoring program, preparing High School youth to be co-facilitators/mentors to middle school youth, and middle school youth to elementary age children.

  • Youth Leadership builds on the Four Principles for Living in Peace 
    (Click to read) and teaches high school youth mentoring and leadership skills. 
  • Students attend a summer youth leadership training center, where they deepen their understanding and practice of the program’s core ideas and skills. They now act as teachers and mentors of others – younger children, family members and interested people in their community.                                                                                                                 
    Engaging Parents and Guardians: 


+ These actions are in planning, as part of expanding the presence and service of 
Kids Create Peace:

Parents (or guardian/mentor) are supported in attending workshops that teach the concepts, methods and skills their children learn. Follow-up support is included.

Children, teachers and parents create a workbook of home exercises that improve interaction among children, parents and other family members. It also enhances their ability to resolve issues and dissension, reducing stress in the family and adding measurably to the children’s self-confidence, knowing they are important members of the family matrix.

                


Elena Chvany, Exec. Dir., Co-founder
Ph: 760.641.7221 Fax: 760.424.8811

Isaiah Landers, Co-founder, Program Developer
Cell: 760-409-5320

Christine Dura, Senior Lead Facilitator, Program Developer
Cell: 760-835-8909

www.onevoiceofpeace.org
www.facebook.com/kidscreatepeace

year in 2011-2012, in one elementary school in Palms Springs, brought invitations
to four schools for the next year.  
This school year, KCP has been invited to six elementary schools , one Boys & Girls
     Club, and is adding one Middle School. 
     Principals of other schools are interested, but like most schools, they don’t (yet)
     have the funding.

Since
     its pilot year working with 5th graders, KCP has added 3rd,
     4th, and 6th grade.   

KCP’s future:    One Voice of Peace plans to take KCP  Valley-wide in two years, state-wide in three years and nation-wide in five.  
KCP’s magical methodology
Consistency: We’re with these students,
for one hour a week for 20 weeks, during or after the school day.  A variety of methods stir the students' interest:  discussion, journaling, video
clips, skits, students’ presentations, games, role-playing, and dyads – (where
the kids face one on one, often with someone they didn’t yet know very well, and speak
with honesty on a topic of importance to both.) And as one of our kids said, “It’s the first time I felt someone was
really listening to me” 
              With all these methods, the kids have
direct experience of the changes they can easily make:  in relationships, circumstances and
events.  This empowers them to bring what
they now understand, to all areas of their lives! 

We’ve learned from parents’ “before”
and “after” surveys that parents truly see the changes in their children’s
attitude and behavior – that increases harmony in their home-life (which is all
too often very stressful these days).
What we need – And what you receiveWe need your participation! 
We can’t do this by ourselves. 
This is a national cause: 
helping our young people become the best they can be, by starting early
in life, with the support they need and deserve.
As you may know, most schools have little or no money for these
“extra” programs.  This is why we are inviting
you to join us in raising money, so we can provide our KCP program free of cost
to the schools that lack funds for these programs.


What you’ll receive:

The realization that you are
     directly involved in changing lives – for the better!  

And you’ll also be able to sign up
     for a thank you gift from us – some of which are shown here – related to
     the size of your contribution. 


$5 -
$250 – Your name on list of supporters on OVP’s website


 $250
- $500 (Same as above) & Choice of any one gift


$500
& above – Combo totaling three items plus your name on
website list
(PLEASE CHECK PREFERENCES) 
                                   


Your contribution confirms you
     are part of KCP's  journey to become world-wide.

You’ll
be able to look back, as years pass, and know that you were part of getting One Voice of Peace, its programs and  benefits more widely known. Get on board and help make KCP reach children
and youth and their families nation-wide and in many other countries.  Imagine what it will be like to have people
everywhere able to resolve differences and disagreements, even conflict – into
peaceful, productive outcomes!  Isn’t
this one of our highest of human visions?                                                            

Indiegogo’s role in raising
money:
Given
the size of this vision, we are not asking for much money at this time.  Our goal now is $80,000 – enough to cover KCP's basic expenses for the upcoming school year.
Budget Highlights:
  KCP Program costs:  for
20 weeks, in 6 venues, each with 2 classes (units)  
  $6,712
each school  (or $3,356 per unit, e.g. 6th grade or B&G Club)  Cost covers:


3 Lead Facilitators, 3 Co-facilitators 


2 Program Developers

Website Maintenance 



Accounting
Supplies
Equipment
Insurance                            



 Methodology:
Kids Create
Peace is a 20-week, one hour per week, after school session, and
explores how conflict begins:  the cultural assumptions and judgments that
cause separation, prejudice, and hostility.

The
     program introduces a set of concepts, to be understood and applied through
     experiential, “anchoring” activities, such as games, role-playing and
     short videos; written material, like songs, poetry, plays, speeches,
     quotes, and newspaper and magazine articles. These are chosen and
     used in ways that allow students to see how patterns of judgmental
     behavior and conditioned thinking create unwanted “drama”, trauma and
     stress in their lives – and in the lives of those around them.
Students
     learn the value of ‘journaling’ (recording their thoughts about class discussions
     and important things they can share with family members.)
We
     share a few moments of ‘mindfulness’ quiet time at the beginning of each
     session to ease stress, and set up a relaxed environment.
We
     demonstrate how easy it is to cooperate, appreciate each other (including our
     diversity), and to create together. Kids and youth directly experience
     the positive changes they can create in relationships, circumstances and
     events. Thus they experience themselves as peacemakers!

In summer seminars, school
breaks, etc., teachers and other educators are trained in the program’s ideas
and in use of its materials.  All are independently funded, therefore no
added expense for school systems.
Benefits of Kids Create
Peace:
This program
teaches kids and youth how to get along, to appreciate each other, to work
together from mutual respect. This means it encourages and supports these
results:Keep children and
youth out of trouble.
♦ Reduce conflict and
violence – among each other, and within their family         environment.
♦ Replace bullying
with friendship.
♦ School is more fun.  No fear of being
confronted or challenged in halls, rest rooms, lunch rooms, playgrounds, or
even in the classroom.
♦ Academic
proficiency.  Without class disruptions
(note-sending to each other,       interrupting the teacher or another classmate,
snacking during class – reported by teachers early in KCP’s time in schools) –
the teacher’s presentations are heard, and students know they will be too, when
they participate in class discussions.
♦ Each child feels
respected, has confidence that their unique self is seen and 
  appreciated.
♦ Their different
learning styles are supported 
♦ Teachers are no
longer distracted by behavior problems, and can devote their time and energy to
their true passion:helping kids learn and thrive, intellectually, socially,
emotionally
Tools and skills acquired:
♦ Responsibility ♦ Accountability ♦ Deeper listening ♦ Critical thinking ♦ Appreciation of
their own and others’ feelings ♦ Self-esteem ♦ Creativity ♦ Empowerment: experience of being
“in charge of oneself”– able to affect  situations in a positive way -- despite any conditions
in their lives ♦ Social responsibility ♦ Leadership
In summary:  Greater
opportunity for academic success – a key to moving up the ladder to a
successful and fulfilling life.
Youth Leadership:
+  Currently in development, is an
expanded extension of Kids Create Peace. We are developing a two-level Youth Leadership/Mentoring program, preparing High School youth to be co-facilitators/mentors to middle school youth, and middle school youth to elementary age children.


Youth Leadership builds on the Four Principles for Living in Peace (Click to read) and teaches high
     school youth mentoring and leadership skills. 
Students
     attend a summer youth leadership training center, where they deepen their
     understanding and practice of the program’s core ideas and
     skills. They now act as teachers and mentors of others – younger
     children, family members and interested people in their community.                                                                                                                 Engaging Parents and
Guardians: 



+ These actions are
in planning, as part of expanding the presence and service of Kids Create
Peace:
Parents (or
guardian/mentor) are supported in attending workshops that teach the concepts,
methods and skills their children learn. Follow-up support is included.
Children, teachers
and parents create a workbook of home exercises that improve interaction among
children, parents and other family members. It also enhances their ability to
resolve issues and dissension, reducing stress in the family and adding
measurably to the children’s self-confidence, knowing they are important
members of the family matrix.                 

Elena Chvany, Exec.
Dir., Co-founderPh: 760.641.7221 Fax: 760.424.8811
Isaiah Landers,
Co-founder, Program DeveloperCell: 760-409-5320
Christine Dura, Senior
Lead Facilitator, Program DeveloperCell: 760-835-8909
www.onevoiceofpeace.orgwww.facebook.com/kidscreatepeace

story:
Short Summary

I'm a freshman student at the University of South Florida starting a major in accounting. I graduated in june/2014 with high honors at the University High School in Puerto Rico. As you may know colleges are getting way to expensive and is really hard to get all the money to cover it. With a simple contribution of money you'll  be helping me to pay for my college experience and start on the right foot.

What We Need

Basically I need $17,324 to cover my tuiton & fees, $1,000 for books & supplies and around $1,600 for transportation for the entire year. From this $19,924 I received $5,730 from the Pell Grant. The remaining $14,194 I need to either took them from a Federal Loan or raise it with you guys. 

The Impact

With this contributions I'll be able to pay for college here at USF Tampa, Fl. The main reason that I decided to study abroad is because I need to get completely bilingual so I can apply for a job at an investigative agency at the federal government, which is my life dream. The contributions I receive with this campaign will make sure that I stay of this college here at Tampa and I continue to build my future.

What Makes This Project Unique

What makes my project most unique is that I'm eager to start my college experience abroad, that I'm working really hard to get an education and be someone that matters in the world, someone that could really make a change.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute money, but that doesn't mean you can't help me in other ways. You can share this link with your friends on every single social network to spread the word and make some noise of my campaign. Remember that you can use the Indiegogo share tools. Thanks for everything!!

story:
My name is Julia DeJesus, and I am a sociology major at Vanderbilt University.  I am currently studying abroad for the semester in Cape Town, South Africa, participating in a service-learning program. As part of this program I decided to volunteer at Ned Doman High School in Athlone, a small suburb of Cape Town. Ned Doman is extremely underprivileged but with the help of a very passionate principal, the school has improved vastly over the past few years.  One of the first things that the principal, Mr. Philander, mentioned to me was that he wanted to implement a garden on the campus in order to help the students understand that they deserve to be surrounded by beauty.

After conducting research on the positive impacts of plants in a workplace I have decided to take on the garden and addition of plants to the school as my Capstone project.  Some plants have already been placed in the courtyard but the addition of many more is still necessary, along with giving the students a place to sit within the garden.  With your help and generosity I hope to add 4 picnic tables to the courtyard, giving more students a place to eat and hang out during interval, as well as more plants to fill in the garden.

Throughout the rest of my time here I will be measuring the levels of students’ self esteem as well as their view of themselves as learners.  In order to keep the garden groomed and in shape I will look for students with an interest in and willing to help while I am here and to continue to do so once I leave.  Along with these students, a government-run team placed in the school called Fusion is enthusiastic to take on the project and continue the cultivation of the garden after my departure.  My hope is that the addition of plants and the beautification of the campus will improve not only the students’ academic focus but also their self-esteem.

The growth of this garden over the coming years has the ability to impact hundreds of students and with your generosity we have the chance to get it underway and “blossoming!”  Any contribution is greatly appreciated and would make a huge difference in the impact of this project and on the students’ lives. 

Regardless of whether you can contribute funds please share this link with family and friends to help get the word out!

Thank you so much for your support, the students of Ned Doman and I are extremely appreciative of your help in the launch of this project!!

story:
Short Summary

Some of you may have picked up a hip hop mixtape from us in the past year.  We call this program Music for Justice:


HipHopForChange produces albums of collaborative works with featured local progressive artists via mixtapes and original albums.  This program delivers powerful narratives covering a diverse array of social issues and perspectives to thousands of listeners.


Right now, we are working to expand this program to facilitate a broader reach, more artists, and even better quality CDs for our audiences.  To do this, we need your help!

What We Need & What You Get

HipHopForChange looking to acquire an Epson Discproducer Autoprinter for our production of Music for Justice music.  This single device will allow us to produce CDs 15 times faster!  It will also give us the following benefits:

  • production of 100 CDs in 2 hours

  • high quality color printed covers

  • a fully stocked Grassroots program



Check out our donation rewards.  We’re offering mixtapes, shirts, and beanies as thanks for your support.  You’ll get the first disks created with our new printer and the music that represents the best of progressive hip hop in the Bay!

The Impact

Music for Justice creates impact in a variety of ways.  We seek out artists who educate their listeners about personal and community struggles for social justice.  These voices are left out of the mainstream and under-represented even at the most basic community venues.  Music for Justice gives a platform for street prophets, scholars, poets and orators of our generation.

As well as combining the voices of different artists in our annual albums, this program also creates original music through highly discounted studio production.  We view the ability to distribute this music as an important part of decentralizing the way people consume culture and media, as well as decreasing the demand for industry-produced rap, which puts a premium on oppressive and self-destructive themes.

Risks & Challenges

As with so many great community projects, we are always on a shoestring budget.  In order to upgrade our music production, we need the extra support.  Without it, we will have difficulty keeping up with demand and our growing Grassroots program.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that budgets are tight, so if you can’t contribute to this campaign, please do us the favor of sharing on your social media page!


Read more about our Music for Justice program and the many other programs HipHopForChange is involved in here.


Like us on Facebook to keep up with our work and find more information about the issues related to Hip Hop.

story:
The Real Work Of Global Education: Breaking Borders and Building Community

  • Middle School is tough! Grades, friends, emotions... add to that a trip to a foreign country when you have never been on a plane, and what do you have?
  • For a group of 7th graders at Independence Charter School, it is an experience that makes them overcome their fears, step out of their comfort zones, while working with students in Nicaragua and Ecuador to make a meaningful difference in the community.
  • This is the Take Flight program that provides 28 Philadelphia 7th grade students the opportunity to travel to Ecuador or Nicaragua.
  • Independence Charter School is an urban K to 8 elementary school serving 800 students and teaching global education and language acquisition. The school is a diverse cross section of Philadelphia with over 50% of the families qualifying for free or reduced lunch.
  • A key piece of the ICS mission is an authentic global curriculum. TAKE FLIGHT is a life-changing program for those 7th graders who apply for and are chosen to travel to Latin America to meet and work with other students their age in a week of service, cultural interchange and community building.

When I worked at the daycare in Ecuador, I finally understood what my ICS teachers meant when they talked about global citizenship. I had heard about it since kindergarten, but I became a global citizen in Ecuador.
--2014 Take Flight student

As a public school in a time of shrinking budgets, ICS is committed to this program because it works, transforming classroom learning to real world experience. But it’s expensive—travel costs are $1,500-$1,800. WE need your help. ICS must raise $20,000 before November 25 to allow qualifying 7th grade students to travel to either Ecuador or Nicaragua.

The Challenge: Make Take Flight Open to 1/3 of ICS 7th Graders

  • Most middle schools that send students abroad send a handful of kids abroad to do sightseeing. ICS will send 28 students and 4 teachers to 2 Spanish-speaking countries targeting students who have never traveled before.
  • Every contribution you make goes toward the airfare, lodging, and service work of a disadvantaged ICS 7th grader. Most of these ICS 7th graders have never traveled beyond the local region.
  • Last year, TAKE FLIGHT students mixed and poured concrete to helped build a bathroom floor at a Nicaraguan school that had never had indoor plumbing before.

In Nicaragua I didn’t learn any math or science, I learned that people are people. People from rich backgrounds, people who used to live in the dump, and people like us. We’re all just people with the same goal: to make the world a better place.
--2012 Take Flight student

What This Means For Students--And You!

2015 will be the fifth year for TAKE FLIGHT. Here’s what it means:

  • For ICS students: the life altering opportunity to contribute directly to their world.
  • For Nicaraguan and Ecuadorian students: to make lifelong connections to American students and work together for a specific cause.
  • For you: the opportunity to make this ambitious, world-changing initiative a reality.

story:
I'm a 17 year old student who has also been developing Apps and technology for a number of years. Apple announced that there were some scholarships to the WorldWide Developers' Conference 2013, so I developed an App for them, submitted it - and was stoked when I was told this week that I had won!

But... I have to fund my own travel and accomodation - and coming from the UK at such short notice, things are looking very expensive!  

This is such a huge opportunity for me, a chance to meet others and learn more - my passions are technology and Apple (and tea!) - and I hope to develop my own business, which I've already started.

You can see the kind of work I already do at www.djmdevelopment.co.uk

Costs I'd really need some help with are for:

flights - £1400

accomodation - £1350

Some fantastic supporters on Twitter encouraged me to try this way of fund raising - it would be amazing if anyone could help with any of this.

I feel it's a real opportunity of a lifetime for me - just to have won the scholarship is brilliant - but to get there and be at WWDC will be unbelievable...!

Any support would be amazing, not just financial - so if you'd like to help in other ways please just spread the word and share this around.

Here's to the crazy ones... ;)

story:
Kids Steps 4 Life

A collaborative portal for parents, children, educators, tutors, health providers in a team based approach with tools, idea exchange, self-help plan development and sharing, and best practices to help our children. A secure platform provides each member with a unique log in that individualizes their experience, members under 18 can be managed by parental accounts and with consent can share relevant information with appropriate coaches. They will have access to a wide range of tools from personal assessments, personal health history, goal setting, activity tracking, nutrition planning tools, favorites, suggestions, idea exchange areas for other parents with similar experiences, analysis. Other services could be provided in private tutoring, coaching, individualized action plans.

Update 9-30-13

Work with a Coach

Portal feature added to provide mini portals for coaches to work with their members.  Coaches now can provide access to all of their members to collaborate share activities, log notes, schedule sessions and other options will be made available.

 Update 9-15-13

Wellness for Kids

Added portal options to provide children and families a way to challenge themselves through fitness, nutrition and general lifestyle.  Online trackers and tools for social challenges with there friends and family members like Family 5k or Nightly Dinner walk. Education materials around nutrition, fitness and ideas on how to spend more quality time with your child. Prevention checkups and badges for progress.

Helping kids early can have the biggest impact later on in their lives.

ADD and ADHD have a tremendous impact throughout an individual’s life – on their education, income, relationships, jobs, and within their communities. All ages of individuals are impacted from as early as 4 years old throughout the rest of their lives.

Between 2007 and 2009 CDC/NCHS found 8.4%/5.2 million children between 3-17 had as some point been diagnosed with attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

"One study that included clinical assessment of children for ADHD symptoms (8) found that only one-half of children meeting the criteria for ADHD had received a diagnosis of ADHD or regular medication treatment"  Source CDC August 2011

"Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is one of the most common mental health disorders of childhood (1). The symptoms of ADHD (inattention, impulsive behavior, and hyperactivity) begin in childhood and often persist into adulthood. These symptoms frequently lead to functional impairment in academic, family, and social settings (2,3). The causes and risk factors for ADHD are unknown, but genetic factors likely play a role (4). Diagnosis of ADHD involves several steps, including a medical exam; a checklist for rating ADHD symptoms based on reports from parents, teachers, and sometimes the child; and an evaluation for coexisting conditions (5)." Source CDC August 2011

Our goal is to help engage children earlier and empower them through collaboration with family members, educators, tutors, and health providers to have a bigger impact earlier in their lives. This level of support is currently managed in a face-to-face setting and is cost prohibitive. While medication and professional testing is often required to both diagnose and manage the symptoms, we can reinforce and extend the benefits by providing family members and care givers with more efficient ways to recognize earlier indicators, share best practices,and leverage tools and support mechanisms to help the child going forward.

The services are available today but can be very costly to procure and often require months of waiting to schedule testing and meetings.

For those that are diagnosed, commonly prescribed medication can cost up to $150 per month (with a co-pay) for time-released doses. Cheaper versions of the medication are available but require the child to take them multiple times a day.

But thousands of kids fall through the cracks – kids that can be helped earlier in their lives.

Like many other challenges in our daily lives new tools, services, and technology are helping to speed up identification and management of various health issues and improve outcomes. By engaging earlier with newer technologies, leveraging services available in your home, making straight forward process improvements and collaborating with thousands of other people in similar situations, you and your child can live more fully.

Who We Are:

Our team has spent the last seven years developing a core web-based Health application framework that allows our customers to collect data, analyze, collaborate, engage, coach, create action plans, and then report and track outcomes. Since our initial launch, thousands of organizations have interacted with our platform, hundreds of thousands of individuals have been analyzed and hundreds of millions of transactions have been processed.

Our team members have backgrounds in Engineering, Data Analysis, Continuous Process Improvement systems (i.e. Six Sigma, Lean), Behavioral Science and more than 15 years developing web-based enterprise applications.

Kids Steps for (or 4) Life is one of the first times we are providing our platform directly to members. Usually we embed our platform within other corporate services in support of Corporate Wellness Programs, Health Coaching and Bench-marking.

Why is this my personal passion?

This is a cause close to my heart, one in which I have a personal, vested interest.

  1. My wife and I struggled with attention issues with our son and early in his life, we struggled for a couple years trying to figure out what was wrong, what to do about it, and how to manage the condition ongoing. We learned that early identification for less extreme cases of ADD is limited and reports show that it is even more difficult to detect in females. Schools have pulled back from any type of testing most likely due to budget constraints, professional resources and liability. Once you determine testing is needed, it is very expensive and you can wait months to schedule tests. Even for those that can afford it, years can go by during which time support could have occurred, and for those less fortunate, detection and treatment may not occur at all.

  2. For me there is nothing more rewarding to me than working with kids and helping them.

    With this platform we could impact tens of thousands of kids, helping them and their parents. We could have a tremendous effect on kids’ lives and those around them in the long term.

What We Need

We have decided to participate in the Phillips Fellows program for two primary reasons

  1. To raise additional capital to implement our platform within this area. If we exceed our goal,  additional services will be added for all members, such as mobile integration, additional assessments, and interactive collaboration features.

  2. This is the much bigger reason, to engage with a wide variety of potential members, families, and providers to collaborate, support and help increase the impact of our solution on kids’ lives.

  • All capital raised through this campaign will be used in two phases

    • Phase I – implement and launch the portal over the next four months

    • Phase II – add additional services over the next six months.

  • Members will begin receiving limited access accounts right after the campaign has ended.

We want your help to quickly bring this to production, period.

What you get

We have provided various perks for different levels of contribution.

Lower levels are for our supporters and those that would like to donate annual members to kids in need (or you can provide as a gift for someone you know.)

We will work with other organizations to provide the platform, for example, schools, teachers, tutors and anyone that has (or knows) children that show early characteristics and need family support.

One of the direct perks is that you will receive an annual membership, giving you you access to all the tools we currently have and will be adding each year. We will also help provide sources of other local providers in direct support like tutoring or testing facilities depending on the level of support needed.

The highest level of perks are for our provider level that they may be able to provide the service. In 2014 we will extend our service to integrate local providers to help members that may need additional support, such as coaching.

Thanks to all our current and future supporters

Building Blocks that we can use and will add additional specific modules.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you feel you could help more through other methods, let us know.

We are always looking for people to help get the word out, provide contacts with other health and service providers or other methods of funding.

Strategic partnerships will be key long term relationships to provide the most comprehensive range of services to our members.




References
1. Fulton BD, Scheffler RM, Hinshaw SP, Levine P, Stone S, Brown TT, Modrek S. National variation of ADHD diagnostic prevalence and medication use: Health care providers and education policies. Psychiatr Serv 60(8):1075–83. 2009.
2. Barkley RA. Associated cognitive, developmental, and health problems. In: Barkley RA, Murhpy KR, eds. Attention-deficit hyperactivity disorder: A clinical workbook. 3rd ed. New York, NY: Guilford Press 122–83. 2006.
3. Yoshimasu K, Barbaresi WJ, Colligan RC, Killian JM, Voigt RG, Weaver AL, Katusic SK. Gender, attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder, and reading disability in a population-based birth cohort. Pediatrics 126(4):e788–95. 2010.
4. Khan SA, Faraone SV. The genetics of ADHD: A literature review of 2005. Curr Psychiatry Rep 8(5):393–7. 2006.
5. American Academy of Pediatrics. Clinical practice guideline: Diagnosis and evaluation of the child with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder. Pediatrics 105(5):1158–70. 2000.
8. Pelham WE, Foster EM, Robb JA. The economic impact of attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder in children and adolescents. J Pediatr Psychol 32(6):711–27. 2007.
story_txt:
Kids Steps 4 Life


            A collaborative portal for parents, children, educators, tutors, health providers in a team based approach with tools, idea exchange, self-help plan development and sharing, and best practices to help our children. A secure platform provides each member with a unique log in that individualizes their experience, members under 18 can be managed by parental accounts and with consent can share relevant information with appropriate coaches. They will have access to a wide range of tools from personal assessments, personal health history, goal setting, activity tracking, nutrition planning tools, favorites, suggestions, idea exchange areas for other parents with similar experiences, analysis. Other services could be provided in private tutoring, coaching, individualized action plans. 
Update 9-30-13

Work with a Coach

Portal feature added to provide mini portals for coaches to work with their members.  Coaches now can provide access to all of their members to collaborate share activities, log notes, schedule sessions and other options will be made available.
 Update 9-15-13

Wellness for Kids
Added portal options to provide children and families a way to challenge themselves through fitness, nutrition and general lifestyle.  Online trackers and tools for social challenges with there friends and family members like Family 5k or Nightly Dinner walk. Education materials around nutrition, fitness and ideas on how to spend more quality time with your child. Prevention checkups and badges for progress. 





Helping kids early can have the biggest impact later on in their lives.

ADD and ADHD have a tremendous impact
throughout an individual’s life – on their education, income,
relationships, jobs, and within their communities. All ages of
individuals are impacted from as early as 4 years old throughout the
rest of their lives.

"Attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) is one of the most common mental health disorders of childhood (1). The symptoms of ADHD (inattention, impulsive behavior, and hyperactivity) begin in childhood and often persist into adulthood. These symptoms frequently lead to functional impairment in academic, family, and social settings (2,3). The causes and risk factors for ADHD are unknown, but genetic factors likely play a role (4). Diagnosis of ADHD involves several steps, including a medical exam; a checklist for rating ADHD symptoms based on reports from parents, teachers, and sometimes the child; and an evaluation for coexisting conditions (5)." 
                Source CDC August 2011

story:
We can all make a change

I moved from Liberia to Sweden when I was 10 years old and unfortunately, due to the long civil war in Liberia, I haven’t been back since then. This year I finally had the opportunity to travel to Ghana and once again experience life in Africa for one whole month on the countryside after 29 years of living in Sweden. While in Ghana I also had the chance to hold a simple introduction lecture on the importance of healthy eating for two schools in the village I was staying in. This brought back many memories from my own childhood in Liberia and the idea of The Free Smoothie Project started to take shape in my mind.

I have a professional background as a web designer but my passion for health and wellness is moving me more and more towards this area. I now frequently do free lectures and also written an e-booklet on the importance of a healthy body and a strong mind in the current age we are living in.

This is where you come in

The Free School Smoothie Project is all about caring and sharing where there are needs but no local economic support to match the needs. The project is about reaching out to children and meeting some of their basic needs in a more exciting and nourishing way, while also sharing simple ideas on health with them. The project is also about reminding ourselves that all children, no matter of their geographic location, are the main foundation of our future and in order for us to create a bright and peaceful future, with healthy and intelligent minds, we have to start nurturing and taking care of the rising seeds of that future.

After the introduction lecture I held for the school children many of them expressed the need of fruits in their daily school time but sadly could not afford it as fruits are more expansive than the local starchy foods in the village. And as the starchy foods are more affordable to many families, while it also last longer and give longer stomach fullness than the fresh fruits, providing children with daily fresh fruits are therefore looked at as an expensive luxury.

Let’s make it happen

I want to return back to Ghana, visit the same village and the same local school where I held the first introduction lecture and surprise them with your contribution and love. I want to be in this village for a period of 3 to 6 months and share free smoothies made of fresh local fruits with these school children. The plan is to make smoothies for one class every school day, rotating the whole school during the whole period of my stay, while also once a week sharing ideas on the importance of good health with one school class at a time. The idea of making fruit smoothies instead of just delivering a decorative fruit basket is to make fruit eating even more exiting and exotic to the children, and also to encourage spontaneous questions surrounding food and health.

Your help is needed
I need your heart and helping hand in order for this idea to become real and carried out. Simply put, I need contribution from you to make my way back to Ghana, be able to economically stay there for 3 to 6 months, get the equipments needed and have the financial backup to actualize the project.

If the financial goal of this project is not fully reached but still able to support at least half the cost of the project, the project will still be carried out but with adjustments - the smoothies will be changed to a daily fruit basket and the duration of my stay will be half the time to minimize costs and increase flexibility.

Be part of the journey

Contributors will be able to follow the project primarily on the free online photo-sharing and social networking service Instagram through photo imaging with simple comments. Due to no fixed and reliable internet connection in the village, a Smartphone with an Instagram app is more preferable here for simple photo sharing and simple interactivities via the local online Smartphone service.

A little gift from me to you
Contributors will also receive my e-booklet on health – a 33 page PDF on how to make small but vital changes to your health, changes your future self and future family will be proud of and give thanks for.

Start sharing and help make a change

Let us make this real – let’s share this idea with family, friends and coworkers and help make change that matters.

Thank you for your helping hand and enthusiasm.

WILLIAM

story:
EMERGENCY FOOD AID FOR GAZA

UPDATE August 14:

I am so overwhelmed by the generous contributions we have received from 923 people so far - $67,412 + another $10,000 that will be sent directly to the Grower's association. Today I worked on the logistics of the operation.  We will find out tomorrow if the international aid organizations in Gaza can effectively distribute such large quantities of potatoes in a short time. If they can't, we will purchase the amount that they can deliver to the most needy people in Gaza and use the rest of the money to purchase something else such as powered milk for babies.  We will take guidance from the international organizations on the ground in Gaza and purchase what is most needed and would be the most helpful. We will stay within the category of food support - so keep the contributions coming.

THANKS

Gershon


The Israeli vegetable growers' association has a surplus of 5000 tons of potatoes that will be destroyed on Sunday. The farmers get .50 NIS per kilo ($0.144) as compensation for not being able to send the potatoes to market. This is a system that exists in most countries with a modern agricultural system.  It aims at protecting the farmers by guaranteeing them a fair price for their hard labor.    We asked the association to donate the potatoes, they simply cannot.  It is against their bylaws and they are an association founded by the growers to protect them.

We can get those potatoes for the same price + shipping and send them to Gaza. For about $730,000 we can send 5000 tons of potatoes to Gaza.

The going price for potatoes today in Gaza is between 4-6 times that price. 

We will arrange for a reputable International Charitable organization working in Gaza to receive them and distribute them to the most needy in Gaza.

All funds contributed to the campaign will go directly for this.  If we collect less money, we will try to bargain with the association to give us more for less.  We will purchase as much as we can with the money collected.

The funds must be committed by Sunday August 17, 2014

UPDATE:  After asking the Israeli vegetable growers association to donate some of the potato surplus to Gaza they responded positively and agreed to reduce the price we will pay by 20%!!! That is a sizable amount of money and will enable us to increase the amount of potatoes we will send to Gaza's neediest people! Spread the word!

story:
About Me

I am Paola Pilnik, a freshman Acting student at the California Institute of the Arts (CalArts). Growing up in São Paulo, Brazil, I was surrounded by amazing theater companies and it's always been a dream of mine to be part of one.

My first encounter with SITI's work was when I was at the National Theater Institute in 2012 and I saw "The Trojan Women". I was mesmerized by the performance and left the theater knowing that I had to work with tem before I died.

SITI Company is one of the most renowned companies in the world, founded by two legends, Anne Bogart and Tadashi Suzuki. Every year they hold a summer workshop in Saratoga Springs and train young professionals in the Viewpoints and Suzuki techniques. I was accepted to this summer's workshop, but I need some help getting there.

"SITI Company was built on the bedrock of ensemble with the belief that through the practice of collaboration, a group of artists working together over time can have a significant impact upon contemporary theater and the world at large."

About the Workshop

"Sixty artists are invited to take part in an intensive workshop that includes hard, physical work, theoretical research, and the generation and performance of new work by each participant. The program’s objective is to develop courageous theater artists who are able to integrate into their work new influences from many disciplines."

Classes are five days a week from May 25 - June 21.

Besides Viewpoints and Suzuki classes, participants will also help out with research related to SITI Company's new production of Aeschylus’ Persians, which will premiere in the Open-Air amphitheater at the Getty Villa in Malibu, California in September of 2014.

What I Need & What You Get

Tuition: $2130

Room & Board: $1568

Plane tickets: $500

Bus tickets from NYC to Saratoga Springs and back: $120

Extra costs (food, etc): $200

I have enough money to pay for everything except tuition and part of room and board.


There are perks avaliable for donations and they are Greek-themed.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation, please share this with friends!

               by each participant. The program’s objective is to develop courageous theater artists
               who are able to integrate into their work new influences from many disciplines."Classes are five days a week from May 25 - June 21.Besides Viewpoints and Suzuki classes, participants will also help out with research related to SITI Company's new production of Aeschylus’ Persians, which will premiere in the Open-Air amphitheater at the Getty Villa in Malibu, California in September of 2014.What I Need & What You Get
Tuition: $2130Room & Board: $1568Plane tickets: $500Bus tickets from NYC to Saratoga Springs and back: $120Extra costs (food, etc): $200I have enough money to pay for everything except tuition and part of room and board.There are perks avaliable for donations and they are Greek-themed.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't make a donation, please share this with friends!

story:
50-to-1 has the potential to shift the climate debate for good!

Watch the video to see how, or read on!

What if we could show you that trying to 'stop' climate change is 50 times more expensive than adapting to it?  And what if we could prove it using numbers and formulas accepted by the IPCC, CRU and other 'consensus' bodies?  Well that's exactly what 50-to-1 does.

The original calculations were done by Lord Christopher Monckton who has since presented his conclusions to audiences of scientists, economists and mathematicians all over the world.  You can see the calculations and a FULL LIST OF SOURCES here: 50 to 1 calculations and sources

Lord Monckton has now approached me to take the above and present it in a video and web package suitable for mass consumption on the internet.  If we can successfully help the general public to understand the futility of 'stopping' climate change and the relative value of adapting, then we can stop wasting money on useless schemes and start putting our money where it will ACTUALLY make a difference.

The 50 to 1 project is designed to get this message to the general public in three different, complimentary ways: 

1. A 7 minute video. This video is designed to be fun, easily understood and contain everything you need to know in one tight and beautifully produced package. This 7 minute video is the centrepiece of the project.  It's designed to be enjoyable, informative and SHORT enough that people will watch it and then pass it on via email and social media.  This in turn will encourage people who want to know more to go to...

2. ... The 50 to 1 website. The website will host the video and more importantly will contain ALL the references for ALL the information contained in the video (see the link above for an example). Anyone who wants to fact-check or dispute the video will have open access to all our sources so they can see for themselves that the conclusions drawn in '50 to 1' are consistent with the science as understood by the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change.  For those who really want to go deep into the issue and wrap their head around the current state of climate economics the website will also host...

3. ... Expert Interviews. So far we have 7 confirmed interviewees, Former President Vaclav Klaus, Prof Henry Ergas, Prof Fred Singer, Anthony Watts, Prof David Evans, Christopher Essex, and Joanne Nova . Whilst excerpts of the interviews will be used in the 7 minute video, the real value is that we will be spending 30 minutes to 1 hour with each of them (so 3.5+ hours combined run time!) and the full interview with each of these internationally respected experts will be available on the 50-to-1 website as they share their thoughts and perspectives on climate change and in particular policy responses such as carbon taxes and trading schemes.

Each part of the 3 part structure is designed to work together, attracting people with the professionally produced, fun, funny and engaging 7 minute video, and then allowing them to fact check and explore on the website and discover for themselves through the interviews the true cost of 'stopping' climate change... which is 50 times more than adapting!

50 to 1 cuts across all the noise and fury surrounding the 'climate debate' and gets right to the point:  Even if the IPCC is right, and even if climate change IS happening and it IS caused by man, we are STILL better off adapting to it as it happens than we are trying to 'stop' it.  'Action' is 50 times more expensive than 'adaptation', and that's a conclusion which is derived directly from the IPCC's own predictions and formulae!

This video, website and interview combination is a game-changer and could radically shift the climate debate.  But it will only have an impact if a large number of people watch the video.  The video needs to be so fun, fast paced and visually engaging that people will not only watch it, but also pass it on for their friends to watch.  7 minutes is an ideal length because it's short enough to keep people's attention, whilst being long enough for us to pack in all the information required to understand the maths and economics behind 50 to 1.  It's effectively a short film which mixes the presentation of the maths and formulae with animations to illustrate every step along the way AND snippets of interviews with internationally respected experts lending the weight of their professional opinions to the subject.

President Vaclav Klaus, Professor Henry Ergas, Professor Fred Singer, Anthony Watts, Professor David Evans, Christopher Essex, and Joanne Nova have all agreed to be interviewed and we are still waiting to hear back from a few others.  Traveling with a production crew (to North America and Europe and back as well as around Australia) to get the interviews, as well as studio filming, editing, animating, colour grading and audio sweetening costs money.  That's why I need your help.

The 50 to 1 project has the potential to shift the climate debate for good.  It has the potential to undermine political attempts to impose more taxes, stupid subsidies and the myriad of 'green schemes' which we've seen spring up in the last decade or so.  It has the potential to save us all a small fortune in years to come if we can totally undermine public support for 'Action' on climate change and shift the focus instead to adaptation as required.

I've enlisted the help of an award winning production company here in Melbourne Australia to ensure the highest possible standard of production.  All up we've calculated a budget (including all the travel etc) of $155,000 to do everything properly, although we can scrape by with less if we cut a few corners, potentially as little as $130,000, but any less than that and it will start to cost us money rather than enable us to pay our bills!

Your donation will help us to reach our minimum budget and once we get there it will be 'game on' and we will be able to get cracking and make 50-to-1 a reality.

This project is being administrated by the Lord Monckton Foundation.  www.lordmoncktonfoundation.com

You can see examples of my previous work at www.theforbiddenhistory.com and www.topher.com.au

story:
My Name is Mike Nelson. Last year I had the privilege of volunteering for an organization called The Light and Leadership Initiative in Huaycan, Peru whose goal is to empower and educate the women and children of that struggling city. Peru has the second lowest quality of education of any country in the world and Huaycan (why-con) is one of the most under served cities in Lima, Peru.

It was amazing to me how simple things like pens, pencils, books and basic art supplies can be luxuries but here in Huaycan they are. The women, children and young adults that are served by LLI are the most hardworking and grateful people I've ever met.

The Light and Leadership Initiative was started by Lara DeVries from Chicago when she was only twenty three years old. Five years later this little school is doing well but they need our help.

With the recent crisis at the border and children streaming in from our neighbor countries to the south seeking better opportunities and education, the time has never been better to make a real difference in the lives of these kids right where they live.

I am a poet from New England and I host a 16 year old reading in Portsmouth New Hampshire called Beat Night. While I was in Huaycan I asked Lara if I could do a Beat Night style poetry reading with some of her teen students and she said yes. It was a huge success. Part of the goal is to keep beat night in Hauycan going which includes building a library of poetry and the printing of books of the students work. All of your donation will go directly to LLI to help continue to educate and empower the women, children and young adults they serve. Thank You!

story:
Project Summary

This documentary will feature the journey of four American inner-city students and their martial arts teacher to Wudang Mountain in China.  This trip evolved from a martial arts and health class in a drop-out prevention program that was taught by Dr. Mike Cermak, co-founder of the Green Dragons.  The Green Dragons uses martial arts to train discipline and focus but adds an environmental perspective by learning to grow healthy and sustainable food with students from kindergarten to high school age.  We have already completed the first trip in June 2013 and want to return a second time to bring two more students and finish gathering footage and story we need for the documentary.  The film is built around the story of the students and how martial arts and environmentalism help them find their path in an urban public school system.  We need your donation to make this happen!

The goal for this project is to show, from the youth perspective, the challenges faced in urban public schools and make a clear statement for the power of combining the physical, mental and environmental in education.  Other films and documentaries such as Waiting for Superman, Freedom Writers, Boys of Baraka, and March Point have highlighted the difficulties of youth in urban schools as well as shown some interventions that have done well. This documentary will fit within this genre of urban education and programs for urban youth of color, but have an added martial arts and environmental twist.

See the original funding video from 2013 here:

PRESS

An article about the first trip to China


Article on The Green Dragons from Boston Magazine

What We Need

Our first fundraising goal is $6000 as a minimum to bring three students to China this year in late June.  Dr. Mike Cermak is paying his own way for the trip.  All funds go directly to the student costs.

The funding to take one person on this trip costs in total approximately $3200.

$2100 - Round-trip air and train from Boston, MA to Wudang Shan in China (with a stop in Beijing)

$750 - training, meals and lodging for 10 days in Wudang with Master Bing

$200 - Visa application and travel insurance fees

$150 - share of lodging/touring costs in Beijing

Each student is raising $700 of their own to partake in the trip and along with other small funding this equals around $2000 per student.  So, $6000 will allow us to take Vanely, Franklin and Deandre on this life-changing trip!. 

STRETCH GOAL

If we can raise closer to $10,000 this will ensure we can make Wudang Trip 3 happen in 2015 and bring another two students on the trip.  All funds donated will go directly to funding student travel and training costs.  If we raise even more than this it just makes one less grant we have to write for the future.  Any extra funds will be put in the bank for future trips.  Our intention is to use the first cut of the film to tour around New England to keep raising money for the trips.  


Who We Are


The Green Dragons combine training martial arts with learning to grow food for Boston youth K-12.  Founded in 2012, the organization has conducted over 40 programs and given many workshops in the New England area.  Dr. Mike Cermak, is the co-founder of The Green Dragons with Matt Briggs and Ben Warner of the internationally-acclaimed Yang's Martial Arts Association (YMAA).

Filmmaker Mike Cermak's PhD is in the Sociology of Environmental Education and he has produced dozens of videos with urban youth about their environmental and education experience. He also has made one short film, "Planting For Peace: Bury Seeds, Not Bodies"(2010) that he produced and co-wrote with urban youth about their connection of gardening with movements to stop gang violence. Cermak is an award-winning environmental educator and has been working in the Boston public schools for a decade.

What You Get

We have great kickbacks with some, like tickets to the opening night of the film, in limited supply.

Digital Photos from China ($10-24)

We have tons of pictures from the first trip and will have more from the second trip.  If you donate $10-$20 you can have full access to our database and one printing of a 5x7 on us!

Exclusive access to our video club ($25)

Get monthly updates that include exclusive access to interviews, project updates and unreleased footage from the film.  This will come in the form of an e-mail with links to media.  This perk lasts for a full year.

A DVD of the film ($30)

$30 gets you a copy of the DVD which will include the educational version released in June and the longer cut due out in June 2015.  This will have a ton of extra content and interviews as well as our best photographs from the trips.  A great deal!

The Shows 

Our opening night screenings will feature the full film, a kung fu demonstration and speeches by the youth in the film!  All attendees get this plus a local and healthy buffet-style dinner! How much would you pay for dinner, a movie and a show?

$50 gets you a ticket to the opening night screening on June 9th,2014 (30 tickets are available on Indiegogo only) AND a copy of the DVD

$75 gets you a ticket to the opening night screening in June 2015 (40 tickets are available on Indiegogo only) AND a copy of the DVD

Train with the Green Dragons

$200+ or more gets you two 60 minute sessions training with the Green Dragons. Come observe a kids class and then train some of your own moves.  

Honored in the Credits

$500+ Get your name in the special thanks credits in the film. Receive a DVD and two  tickets to the screening of your choice. 


The Impact

Your donation goes directly to funding the students experience on the trip.  Every dollar you give helps us provide the most enriching trip possible.  Both Cedonne and Vanely report how this trip directly helped them see school in a new way and get what they need to get done for graduation.  Now that we have already done one trip we can amplify the impact for the new students each year.  


Other Ways You Can Help

1. Book us a screening ($350 minimum): We will come to your school, show the film, do a kung fu demo and share our stories from the trip.  This is a great educational opportunity for environmental classes (K-16), martial arts schools or anyone interested in urban education.  Please contact mike@thegreendragons.com to discuss details. 

2. Give us garden work: Do you have a gardening or landscaping job in the Boston area that needs some hard work?  We are happy to bring the team, including some of the students going to China, to your job.  We love getting outdoors and of course working with plants.  Please contact mike@thegreendragons.com to discuss details.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Abigail Bartee. I am in my third year of studying Romance Languages (Spanish, French, and Italian) and International Studies at Truman State University in Kirksville, Missouri. After I complete my degree, I will work for international nonprofits. My previous international volunteering experiences include volunteering with the Missionaries of Charity in Morocco and participating in the Clean Water Project in Haiti. 

I have been given the opportunity to participate in a medical mission trip this July with the LAUGHH Foundation in Bucaramanga, Colombia. While there, we will be distributing medical supplies, conducting various health education sessions, and providing primary care. Your donations will help fund volunteer expenses as well as medications and other medical supplies. 

You can go to laughh.org to learn more about the foundation.

What We Need & What You Get

In total, my trip will cost around $2,000. I am trying to raise half of that through donations. This will cover my plane ticket and my room and board in Bucaramanga, as well as medications that will be purchased there. I am offering a few perks for different donation amounts! For a $5 donation, I will bring you the coolest postcard that I can find in Colombia. For a $15 donation, I will bring back an awesome magnet from Colombia, which will become the focal point of your fridge. Finally, for a $35 donation, I will bring you a bag of fantastic Colombian coffee!

story:
What's Up & Why We're Here

Hi! We're Andy, Atman, and Ali, the co-founders of the Holistic Life Foundation, a 501(c)3 non-profit organization bringing yoga & mindfulness to under-served communities for over 12 years, both in our hometown of Baltimore, Maryland and internationally.

Growing up, our father taught us (Ali & Atman) about yoga and mindfulness. When we got to college, we met Andy, and together we came up with the idea to bring our experience with holistic practices to the community. (That's the short version of the story, which you can see on TEDxTeacher's College here).

Patterson High serves a number of really at-risk students, just look at the following statistics:
  • End-of-year suspension rates up to 16% of students
  • A 4-year graduation rate of only 86% of students
  • More than 60% of students are absent more than 20 days each year
  • The school's state testing falls far below the average in Maryland.
What we aim to do, with your help and the help of some of our partner organizations, is take our own, proven yoga & mindfulness curriculum into Patterson High School with hopes to improve participation in class, academic scoring, and graduation rates, while helping the 1,000 students find some inner peace of their own.

What We Need & What You Get

Launching this program is REALLY expensive - more expensive than you might think. The entire program will cost us around $160,000 when all is said and done. (WOAH. We know).

This money will be going towards the Mindful Moment trainers, Mindful Moment staff, classroom supplies, administrative expenses, and more.

Thanks to our generous benefactors at The 1440 Foundation and The Zanvyl and Isabelle Krieger Fund, we're already covered up to $60,000.

But that leaves around $100k left to pave the way for this game-changing program at Patterson.

The 1440 Foundation has graciously offered us another $25,000 for the program if we can do just one thing:  Fund the extra $75,000 ourselves.

It's a big goal, but we know that we can reach it with your help.

As a "thank you" for your contribution, we're offering a number of cool and unique perks, which you'll see in the side bar over here. ----->

Did we mention that we're a non-profit? That means that your donation is tax-deductible. If you'd like a receipt, make sure to include your address when you donate.

The Impact

We will also be working with The Institute for Integrative Health and the University of Maryland School for Integrative Medicine to conduct a study to gauge the results of this program, with results being released at a future date.

Here's why this is such a huge deal:

Patterson High students come from low-income families in a high unemployment area. This kind of program will literally change their lives (and there are over 1,000 of them!).

Our first afterschool program of just 20 kids was phenomenally successful. Within just 2 months, all of the kids in the program were no longer getting detentions, were showing up to their classes, and, for the first time ever, passing all of their classes. Some of those same students now teach for us at local colleges, in the afterschool program, and at senior centers in the city.

Since then, we've been teaching all over the place, with students ranging from kindergarteners to senior citizens.

We know that this kind of work with inner-city youth makes a tremendous impact not just now while they're in school, but in the future in their community.

So, what do you say?

If everyone reading this donated just $10, our campaign would be over in a day.

For just $5 or $10 (or more, if you're able), you can dramatically impact the quality of the lives of over 1,100 students at Patterson High, as well as their families, neighbors, and community. Think about that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to donate right now?

Not a problem!

Here's some things you can do to help us in other ways:

  • Help us get the word out - make some noise!
  • If you've got radio, TV, or media connections, we'd love to share this project and our work with them!
  • If you're online, you've probably got a Facebook page, maybe you're even on Twitter and Pinterest. Use the IndieGoGo share tools to share this campaign with the people in your life.
story_txt:
What's Up & Why We're Here
Hi! We're Andy, Atman, and Ali, the co-founders of the Holistic Life Foundation, a 501(c)3 non-profit organization bringing yoga & mindfulness to under-served communities for over 12 years, both in our hometown of Baltimore, Maryland and internationally.Growing up, our father taught us (Ali & Atman) about yoga and mindfulness. When we got to college, we met Andy, and together we came up with the idea to bring our experience with holistic practices to the community. (That's the short version of the story, which you can see on TEDxTeacher's College here).Patterson High serves a number of really at-risk students, just look at the following statistics:


End-of-year suspension rates up to 16% of students


A 4-year graduation rate of only 86% of students


More than 60% of students are absent more than 20 days each year


The school's state testing falls far below the average in Maryland.

What we aim 
to do, with your help and the help of some of our partner organizations,
 is take our own, proven yoga & mindfulness curriculum into 
Patterson High School with hopes to improve participation in 
class, academic scoring, and graduation rates, while helping the 1,000 
students find some inner peace of their own.What We Need & What You GetLaunching 
this program is REALLY expensive - more expensive than you might think. 
The entire program will cost us around $160,000 when all is said and 
done. (WOAH. We know).This money will be going towards the Mindful Moment trainers, Mindful Moment staff, classroom supplies, administrative expenses, and more.
Thanks to our generous benefactors at The 1440 Foundation and The Zanvyl
 and Isabelle Krieger Fund, we're already covered up to $60,000.
But that leaves around $100k left to pave the way for this game-changing program at Patterson.The 1440 Foundation has graciously
 offered us another $25,000 for the program if we can do just one 
thing:  Fund the extra $75,000 ourselves.
It's a big goal, but we know that we can reach it with your help. As a "thank you" for your contribution, we're offering a number of cool and unique perks, which you'll see in the side bar over here. ----->Did we mention that we're a non-profit? That means that your donation is tax-deductible. If you'd like a receipt, make sure to include your address when you donate.The ImpactWe will also be working with The Institute for Integrative Health and the University of Maryland School for Integrative Medicine to conduct a study to gauge the results of this program, with results being released at a future date.

Patterson High students come from low-income families in a high 
unemployment area. This kind of program will literally change their 
lives (and there are over 1,000 of them!).

detentions, were showing up to their classes, and, for the first time 
ever, passing all of their classes. Some of those same students now teach for us at local colleges, in the afterschool program, and at senior centers in the city. Since then, we've been teaching all over the place, with students ranging from kindergarteners to senior citizens.
We
